title: I will definitely return!
text: The hotel is in a perfect location. The staff was knowledgeable and accommodating. There are stores, eateries, and all sorts of places available for everyone’s pleasure.  I had a wonderful stay. And I will definitely return.

title: First experience in New York: perfect
text:
Excellent location: the hotel is located in the "Tudor City" district, the history of which is explained on a sign in the entrance hall. The location is central but quiet, compared to Times Square. I recommend going up to the Tudor City bridge, the view overlooking the 42nd is breathtaking!
The hotel staff is pleasant and efficient.
Our room on the 7th floor was quiet, spacious and clean. Comfortable bedding and cleaning is done every day. A small fridge, very practical, a large wardrobe and a rather large bathroom for New York.
The hotel is quite human in scale despite its 20 floors; the elevators are sufficiently numerous and fast.
In the surrounding area, there are many varied food options and it is possible to buy some foodstuffs at the hotel. Tables and 2 microwaves are available at the hotel bar and you can bring food from outside without any problem.
If necessary, the hotel also offers a secure luggage storage service.
In short, I recommend this hotel in every way!

Please note: tourist taxes are to be paid upon arrival and are quite high (for 5 nights, we paid $200).

title: Close to Geand central terminal
text:
Comfortable hotel located near Grande central terminal and Summit,
 Spacious bedroom with large closet, king size bed, excellent bedding. Housekeeping done every day. I recommend this hotel. We stayed there for 7 nights. Good quality ratio

title: Let down by staff
text: Came here with my partner last week and I can't fault the hotel itself, the location and room were all fantastic! Almost everything was in walking distance. The reason for only 3 stars was due to the person staying in the room next to us. At around 11pm to 1am in the morning they would have the TV so loud and blasting the hairdryer every night meaning neither of us could sleep, every night I would call reception who would say they'd deal with it however nothing was done. By the 3rd night I was so frustrated by this also due to the lack of sleep and asked to move rooms to which I was told we couldn't because there were no more available. Felt completely let down by the staff who are supposed to ensure an amazing stay whilst at this hotel but instead had to endure the person next door who was completely inconsiderate of other people staying here!

title: Can't wait to stay at Westgate Grand Central again!
text:
The best experience I've ever had at a hotel. My husband, 5 year old daughter, best friend, and I traveled to NYC for four nights for our daughter's 5th birthday. The room was a really good size, especially from what we'd seen of rooms in NYC, and it was very clean. Our room was on the 19th floor, right on 42nd and was very quiet, even with the window ajar. We'd hear ambulances, and on Sunday morning, the cheers of those watching the marathon, but overall, it was quiet. 

ALL of the staff was absolutely amazing. They all knew us as we came and went, opened doors, helped us get up the stairs with the stroller, and treated us each with kindness and respect. It had a family vibe for us that we loved, and I imagine if you'd like more of the upscale, dote on me vibe, they'd provide that as well. They are very perseptive and professional.

On the evening of our daughter's birthday, her and I were waiting in the lobby for my husband to get back from the store, and four of the staff that were there at the front desk SANG HAPPY BIRTHDAY to my daughter and the manager then brought out a box of fancy little sweets as a gift. 

There's a full bar downstairs, a little area where you can purchase snacks, and a dining area with a bunch of tables where you can bring food, read a book, do some work, or just hang out and relax after miles of walking. Never had to wait on elevators.  

Upon departure, 42nd and 2nd were both shut down due to the marathon, but Freddie got our luggage (4 large bags, a few small others, some shopping bags) to 41st and 2nd where our Uber picked us up. He helped load it all up, took a picture with our daughter, and said he loved us (which as a family, warmed out hearts immensely)! We will be back to NYC later this year, and we will stay here again, no question.

title: Westgate grand central
text:
Very nice hotel, located close to everything
Very comfortable bedding and spacious room
Pleasant staff
Please note free resort debited on arrival and not on departure
Good cocktails but a little expensive, although in New York everything is expensive (transport, food, etc.)

title: Muy bueno
text: El hotel está impecable, cerca de todo pero en una zona encantadora y tranquila. . Es un hotel con encanto, se lo ve muy limpio y cuidado. Nuestra habitación estaba impecable, tenía dos ventanas, una se veía el río. Me pareció divina la vista.. Y nos resultó muy agradable todo. Las camas eran cómodas. El baño está bien. Aunque algo frío en comparación con la habitación. Siempre nos hicieron el servicio de habitación menos el último día, no sabría porque la señora de limpieza nos había visto salir. Así y todo me pareció un hallazgo este hotel. Lo conseguí a muy buen precio, ya que llegamos el 24 de diciembre y todo es mucho más caro. Me cambiaron las toallas siempre, siempre repusieron los productos de aseo. Tiene una mini heladera que nos vino muy bien para las bebidas. Y también había una cafetera. Abajo hay una barra para café y bebidas. El personal fue muy amable en toda nuestra estadía.  Volvería, me gustó mucho la ubicación y el hotel.

title: Super hotel
text: Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet hôtel (par Carrefour voyages). Il est central, proche de toutes les animations (10 mn à pieds de la gare centrale, 20 mn de time square). Nous avions pris une carte de métro à la semaine. L'hôtel est très propre (ménage tous les jours), le personnel est aux petits soins (portier, réception, bar) 24h sur 24. Le matin le barman nous donnait un sac comprenant un fruit, un jus d'orange, un yahourt, une viennoiserie (qu'on peut échanger) et une boisson chaude Starbucks. Il y a des tables et 2 micro ondes pour manger, 2 supermarchés à moins de 5 mn pour des plats à réchauffer. La literie est très bonne et la salle de bain agréable. Nous avions une chambre (4eme étage) au bout du couloir loin des ascenseurs donnant dans une rue un peu bruyante (travaux et camion poubelle) mais rien de bien méchant. Nous avons eu un soucis de chambre à notre arrivée (simple au lieu de double) mais qui a été vite résolu le lendemain, direction très réactive. Pour finir, il y a du personnel qui parle très bien français ce qui facilite les échanges. Si je dois retourner à NYC, il y a de fortes chances que je sélectionne cet hôtel à nouveau.

title: Pleasant New York Stay
text: Our stay at the Westgate New York Grand Central was very pleasant.  The staff were very were welcoming and helpful.  The hotel was quiet.  Our room was large by New York standards.  The hotel is in walking distance to several restaurants and shopping and the United Nations.

title: Away from all the madness but close enough to walk 🗽🇺🇸
text:
Would definitely recommend! 
Location was walking distance (10 minute) down the street from Grand Central Terminal, 20 minutes walk to Bryant Park, 30 minutes walk to Time Square. Plenty of sights to take in on the way. We felt in a safe area and away from all the madness of Time Square. Plenty of wine stores, CVS, Dunkin’s and stores all around and nearby. 

Rooms were all tastefully decorated in a modern design and had all toiletries supplied. Large flat screen tv. The beds were amazing!! So soft and comfortable, best beds I’ve slept in for  a while… 2 blinds on windows so you have blackout. No noise from outside although very close proximity to other hotel room windows and close by apartment block, which is usual in New York, rooms were on the bigger size for New York. Ice bucket in room and ice machine on floors 8 and 14. Tea and coffee machine in room and free bottles of water whenever you wanted it. The resort tax for 4 nights was $160 non refundable and the security deposit is $100 refundable, make sure you’re prepared for this on check in. We didn’t have breakfast although we saw that breakfast was takeaway in a bag with coffee, so can’t comment on that. They let kids stay free in the bedding with the adults, no rollaways available, we had a Queen bed which was massive and plenty of room for 2 adults and 1 10 year old. Showers were powerful. Whole hotel is spotless. Special mention to our maid who cleaned 1215 and 1221, she was top notch and very attentive. 

The thing that sets this hotel aside from all others is the staff, all staff were very friendly and welcoming and would go above and beyond to make your stay more enjoyable. Any request was never too much for them…. They always had a smile! The reception staff, bar staff, cleaners all very friendly. Special mention to Freddie the Bell Captain and Luis the doorman nothing was ever too much for them….. proper New Yorkers and assets to the hotel. I think if Freddie would’ve been able to drop us back to JFK he would’ve!
We felt at home at the Westgate Grand Central and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again next time I am lucky enough to be in New York. 🗽🇺🇸

title: NYC valentines trip
text:
We have just returned home to the UK after a 4 night / 5 day stay in the westgate grand central hotel. 

I just want to start off by saying the staff are great, especially the bell men. The hotel is clean and smells delightful. The hotel rooms are slightly dated furniture wise but they are clean, very squeaky bed which appears to look like a sofa that forms into a bed. 

The hotel has a Starbucks which is also great!!

The hotel itself is very central, it’s a 15/20 minute walk from time square where there is local underground’s. All of your bigger attractions such as empire state, Statue of Liberty the hotel is no where near close to any of these attractions and will require an underground. 

The cab journey from JFK is around one hour long, costs 86 dollars there and 86 dollars back to the airport. Take into consideration rush hour traffic. 

I would highly recommend IHOP for breakfast and I would recommend avoiding juniors diner in time square and stardust in time square (the worst food of our holiday and the most expensive)

On average it’s around 60 dollars for breakfast which is quite expensive but the city itself is self is VERY VERY expensive. 

Overall a great holiday, our first time in newyork been an amazing experience. Would 100% return to hotel cannot fault it, staff are great.

title: We hit a home run with this hotel!
text:
The look, the location and the amenities of the Westgate Hotel Grand Central made our recent stay an absolute winner. It's right on 42nd street at second avenue. I thought it would be a very busy area. Instead, it was just perfect. Centrally located to tons of fine places to eat, to shopping, to transportation, to walking. If you like "looking up," the building structures were dynamic and beautiful. Duck in for a hot chocolate at Zuckers. Have breakfast or lunch at one of the two closest diners (Townhouse and Gemini; we hit both). Head a block north or five or six blocks south to a meal or a hangout. You can get everywhere, so easily. Even back to LaGuardia, whether by Uber or taxi we did both).

The hotel is beautiful. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate. There's a wonderful seating area to meet friends and hang out, across from a "marketplace" and bar where you can have a cocktail or heat up one of the food options in the microwave. 

The room was perfect. Totally updated. Oodles of storage... drawers, closet with cubbies and hanging space. The nightstand had a refrigerator! (We didn't discove that until we were ready to depart.) Bathroom was totally updated and easy. Lush, thick towels and plenty of them. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash and body lotion were upscale and plentiful. The dresser and desk were quite handsome with leather-look fronts drawers and vintage metal feet on the mid-century modern low chest. Plenty of charging stations for phones iPads, and hands-frees. Bed comfort was heavenly, like sleeping on a cloud. Our reservation let the hotel pick our room. When we checked in, we were told they had a king room available if we'd like (and we did).
The staff went to great lengths to please. We'd intended to take Uber to the airport, and it was suggested we might wish to take a taxi. Chafik said he would be happy to get us a cab and a reputable ride. We went with that and it was perfect. Even a little cheaper than Uber would've been.

My companion lost one of her favorite gloves and thought it might've been left in our room, or dropped in the lobby somewhere. We'd already checked out and checked our luggage to go to lunch. When we got back to hotel, Chafik said he'd gone up to our room to check for the glove (not there). Just going the extra mile was very special. (The companion then thought it might've been dropped/left at the bagel place up the street. That was correct and I retrieved.)

Each time we entered or exited the hotel, the doorman opened the side door for us, or started the revolving door if we were headed that way. Staff was just wonderful. The room was comfortable, the bed was a great respite for hard-walking days. The hotel is centrally located, near Grand Central, and near the UN. In the middle of so many restaurants, stores. Second Avenue, First Avenue are a delight to walk along on the fashionable East side of manhattan in the East 30s and 40s. I'd love to stay at the Westgate ... again and again.

title: Merci pour ce séjour !
text:
Nous sommes allés à New York pour la première fois, séjour réservé via Voyage Privé.
L’hôtel est extrêmement bien situé, à 7min à pieds de la gare de Grand Central, parfait si vous prenez beaucoup le metro.
Nous avons été accueillis comme des rois, spéciale dédicace à Ronny avec qui on a pris l’habitude de discuter et à l’équipe qui faisaient les meilleurs chocolats chauds !

Tout petit bémol, qui n’est qu’un détail, le petit déjeuner est assez répétitif, mais le système « à emporter » est vraiment cool, il permet aussi une très grande plage horaire pour le récupérer (jusque 13h30).
En résumé, en partie grâce à vous, nous avons passé un séjour que nous ne sommes pas prêts d’oublier, je recommande à 100% !

text:

title: Super hotel
text:

The hotel bar is a great place to have a pre drink before exploring this great city or a night cap before turning in .
We will definitely stay at this hotel again on my next trip to New York.

title: Realizing a treasured facet of a lifelong love for a special part of Manhattan...
text:
This was my first stay at the Westgate New York Grand Central and I was very pleased with the courtesy shown both by Reservations agents and Hotel Staff in honoring my request for a terrace room on an upper floor with view toward Tudor City apartment towers, U.N. and East River. This meant a great deal to me as I am a photographer with a long-standing fondness for the Tudor City neighborhood, ever since earliest visits in my teens. and I do a festive birthday week in NYC every year.
Beyond this, when I remarked to Kevin on Front Desk staff, while checking out, how much I had enjoyed the terrace and its view and that I planned to make this "my" hotel for future birthday week and other visits, he volunteered that next time I would have an even better terrace room, and he actually made notation of that assurance on my customer account. Hard to imagine a better view from a terrace than that which I enjoyed with my 16th floor accommodations, but I'm certainly looking forward to whatever upgrade Kevin had in mind for my next stay. 
Aesthetically, Westgate's extensive renovation of this historic hotel is immediately obvious in the inviting lobby with its Art Deco touches and bronze adorned elevators, and rooms themselves, a very nice touch being the double-glazed casement windows, which allowed me to enjoy fresh air when desired and views that augment the major ones from the terrace. Also nice for a photographer, not having to deal with glass reflections. Attractive wall lighting fixtures flanked the bed, with the added feature of high-intensity reading lights on flexible arm - very thoughtful design. The climate system was responsive and commendably quiet in its air-moving.
If all the foregoing positives were not enough, I should add that both room and bath were spotless and comfortable, especially the bedding, and the full-size bathtub proved therapeutic with all the exercise scampering about NYC with full compliment of camera gear. Housekeeping, Front Desk staff, and other representatives of the Hotel were unfailingly friendly and helpful, and made this first time visitor feel like a valued long-term guest of Westgate.

title: Fantastic Location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, old school style.
text:
Fantastic location. Very central all the main tourist hotspots. Easy access to public transport either by bus or nearby Grand Central Station. 

It’s a historic hotel. So has a certain style. Fabulous corner room. On the 19th floor we actually had a nice view of the east river and some beautiful sunrises (not that early as it was winter!) 

Access is an issue for us with an electric wheelchair.  Now we don’t need an accessible room as such. As long as the showers are walking in. We had space to park the wheelchair in the room. The doors were wide enough to get the chair through. 

The lifts were large enough for the wheelchair + 3 to get in. Although a little manoeuvring required. 

Good sized bathroom. 

Very comfortable beds/pillows. Heating -and a/c easy to control and TV (if you have time to watch anything in NYC! 

Again whilst the hotel cannot be adapted fully due to its historic nature, there was a ramp promptly put out for us every time we needed. Particular thanks to Jose and Shafiq the doormen who went above and beyond with assistance and advice. We had a puncture in the wheelchair. Jose even used  his own car to help us get air in the tyre! 

There’s a smaller limited Starbucks/bar in the lobby area which is really handy. 

Friendly helpful staff and a great experience all in and good value.

title: NY feels

I will definitely comeback here if I am in NY. The place was also located at the center so it is accesible to almost everywhere you need to go.

title: Lovely hotel!
text: Lovely hotel. Rooms were lovely. Bed super comfy!  Not much in terms of food at hotel... Just snacks. No view from my room but didn't mind as was out most of the day and eve. Close walking distance to everywhere (Grand Central, Empire State, Vanderbilt, Central Park (30 min walk), Time Square etc. Affordable price for NY. Would defo stay again.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: This is our second year staying in this hotel. We are a group on a bus tour. I highly recommend them. The hotel is really nice, great location and very attentive staff. We couldn’t be happier and will be back next year.

title: Hôtel calme et très bien placé
text:

title: Good hotel but beware of the ‘Resort Charge’
text:
Stayed for a few nights in this hotel for our honeymoon. Got mixed feelings about it to be honest. Rooms are comfortable if a little small, our bed was a pull out sofa bed although it was quite comfortable but not quite what we expected. The location is good with Grand Central nearby and Times Square about 15 min walk away but there was little choice nearby in the way of bars and restaurants to stagger back from although we recommend Peter Dillon’s about a 10 minute walk away. 

Our biggest issue with the hotel was the ‘Resort Fee’. An absolute rip off having to pay for water, coffee, safe, WiFi and the hotel gym. All this stuff is normally included in the rate for a hotel of this standard so it’s a bitter pill to swallow having to pay $200 for six bottles of water over 5 days. 

Big shout out to to Mike and Tony and the rest of the concierge team who went out of their way to help us. Thanks guys 👍

title: Expensive @ the westgate grand central!
text:

Bottle of juice, bag of crisps and a bar of chocolate £16! As we were checking out we noticed we d been charged £218 - by "mistake" which they refunded but how many times have peoole not noticed and not got their refund  !

title: Westgate hotel is enough for a weekend away.
text:

title: A wonderful stay!
text: The Westgate Grand Central was such a wonderful stay for my partner and I for 5 nights. We had just come from an average Airbnb in Brooklyn and this was such a welcoming change. The front desk staff were so helpful, allowing us to leave our bags with them to explore the city before our room was ready. Everyone was super helpful! Our room featured a huge king bed and great size bathroom, as well as a coffee machine. Everything tidy, clean and fresh toiletries each day. My only con was that the room was very poorly lit and having each light on in the room did not make a difference. Should we return to New York one day, Westgate Grand Central will be our very first choice.

title: Fantastic place.
text: Fantastic hotel in a great location. All the staff was amazing. Chafik (I think his name was) was brilliant. We will be back. Hopefully in a couple of months with the kids and hopefully staying a little longer than this time.

title: Good location but watch out for the hidden charges!
text:
Good location in midtown east side close to Grand Central station and 20 minute walk to Times Square.  Nice interior with adequate sized rooms. Great maid service.
On the downside, BEWARE HIDDEN CHARGES - we were charged an extra $240 ‘destination charge’ on checking in. There was no mention of this when we booked, so it was nasty surprise. Front desk staff weren’t very helpful. They couldn’t advise on alternative transport options when our Amtrak service to Canada was cancelled and shrugged when we asked if there was a way to stop the water boiler in our bedroom spewing out old coffee flakes into our drinks.  Maybe pay them better or provide some staff training?

title: Great stay in New York City
text: Very friendly professional staff. Jose the doorman was exceptional... excellent service and very positive. Made our stay a pleasure. Great midtown location by Tudor City and the United Nations. Easy walk to times square. We will definitely be back soon!

title: Mauvaise expérience
text:
Bonjour,
Nous sommes arrivés à l’hôtel Westgate hier soir avec mon mari et mon fils pour 6 nuits. Nous sommes arrivés dans la chambre il n’y avait qu’un lit et un canapé convertible. Le lit n’était pas prêt et il a fallu qu’on le ouvre le canapé et qu’on fasse le lit nous mêmes avec des draps laissé dans une housse. Le matelas du lit est très bien en revanche celui du canapé est très bien pour y passer 1 nuit pas 6 ou alors avec un mal de dos garantie surtout pour un adulte… mon fils a 19 ans et quand ça fait du bruit quand on bouge. Il a également fallu demander une couverture car il n’y en avait pas de prévu. Nous avons demandé à changer de chambre mais comme par hasard l’hôte est complet.
C’est très décevant d’arriver dans un hôtel 4 étoiles qui au demeurant est agréable mais qui ne tient pas compte du confort des clients, et qui n’a pas de canapé prévu pour y dormir. 
Pour 6 nuits j’estime qu’il y a un minimum d’effort à faire.
C’est lamentable !

title: Couple getaway for Billy Joel.

title: Getting the big stuff right...but the little stuff letting it down...

There's a 7/11 type store (CVS) within 2 mins walk and the room has a fridge. 14-hour walking days means I've wanted a night in....and rang down for a drinking glass.  Not possible....only flimsy plastic like they leave in the bathroom. It seems incongruous with a hotel like this....and feels poor. I've stayed in3 different locations ( New Orleans and Memphis prior to here...the  latter not the quality of the former, not the Westgate) but this is the first time I'm drinking out of a paper cup....shame as so easy to remedy

title: Midtown Gem ticks all boxes
text:
I did so much research before this special solo trip to the Big Apple for the first time and although well into my 50s felt as excited as a teenager.
My only concern was whether the hotel I chose from my armchair in UK would be as great as it looked online.
I can resounding and categorically report that this hotel exceeded my hopes and was a major part of the unforgettable times I had in Manhattan.
The art deco elegance of the hotel is in perfect keeping with the style of nearby Chrysler Building and Grand Central.
The rooms are comfortable with excellent beds.
The huge pluses are the room rate which is very reasonable for such a mid to high end hotel and the location which is pretty much perfect as you can walk everywhere throughout midtown, Central Park and Downtown. But it’s far enough away from Times Square to feel quite peaceful.
The blocks surrounding Westgate have a variety of eateries, diners and takeout options.
There is a resort tax when you arrive which seems to be $40 per night but even with this it is remarkably good value for a hotel that truly enhanced my experience.
A special word for Kevin in reception and the very kind cleaning lady who were both very helpful and friendly.
I thoroughly recommend this midtown gem.

text:

We checked in after a 7-hour flight from Europe, plus the usual hassle of getting in from JFK. We'd prepaid the booking, so weren't expecting to be asked for an extra $245 for our 7 day stay. When asked for an explanation and were told it was for "water and stuff". We weren't going to be allowed to check in unless we coughed up, so we reluctantly did. We quickly discovered that delivery to the room was not included in the charge, so made it our business to collect 4 bottles each day - 28 in all making it around €9 per bottle.
The staff were disinterested throught our stay, and not surprisingly we won't be returning.

title: Nada recomendable
text:
Llegamos después de muchas horas de viaje y nos metieron en una habitación de la segunda planta, con el armario lleno de trastos, las paredes arañadas y una mini ventana, además de que los suelos del pasillo eran de cartón. Cuando lo comentamos en recepción, se dieron cuenta de que no había colado y nos cambiaron a otra habitación que no estaba hecha, y lo sabían, pero aún así nos la dieron.
Pensamos que sería circunstancial y que al día siguiente la harían,pero no. Ni un sólo día limpiaron el baño. Las toallas las mal colocaban en los asideros. Lo único que hacían,era la cama. Las ventanas están sucias desde hace años, no están insonorizadas y podíamos escuchar todos los días a los trabajadores delante de la habitación (porque estaban arreglando algo en el tejado).
Además, nos pusieron un habitación que se podía hacer compartida,por lo que sólo nos separaba una puerta y se escuchaba absolutamente todo.
Por otra parte, como la habitación no tenía cafetera,nos dieron 4 vales de 15$ para la taberna. Cada vez que íbamos a comprar, el bartender nos ignoraba. Teníamos que esperar más de 15 minutos hasta que le apetecía atendernos.
El personal no fue nada agradable. Incluso uno de los días, uno de los porteros nos quitó un de los ascensores, metiéndose él primero y diciendo que tenía que subir él sólo.
Sólo hubo un señor el último día que fue amable con nosotros y no nos trató como clientes de segunda.
Lo único bueno, es que está a diez minutos de la estación Grand Central.

title: Definitely not 4star, just ok nothing special
text: Stayed for 3 nights. Given room on 6th floor facing back of the property - terrible view with terrible noise as a platform was going up n down with workers drilling into walls it was extremely loud. Last thing you want after long haul flight. The back facing room was very dark like a dungeon with limited lighting only small lamps no cetral ceiling light. Also the bed was facing 3 lifts on the back of the wall which at night felt like you sleeping next to a train track. The room is ok, not 4star in my view. Would expect a robe, slippers and daily water. There is a small coffee maker of questionable coffee quality, fridge is a plus, there was a hairdryer, iron and a safe and free wifi which are all a plus. Shower gel not topped up ended up using a bar soap. They also lost my teddy bear while changing bed. Seems trivial to some but had a huge emotional meaning to me. Also last day the staff persuaded me to use taxi they called to the airport. Should have gone with my gut and use Uber. Was told taxi will be around $105 which definitely wasn't, was a metered yellow taxi that was charging tolls on top of the fare and also there was no tip option which would be appropriate for the near hit experience on the highway. Ended up paying $140. So just book Lyft or Uber. They go different routes where tolls are not charged and you know the cost upfront. Overall average experience but location was very good.

title: Probably the best hotel under $250 in Midtown
text:
Pros:
- Decent location, 5 minutes from the UN, 10 minutes from Grand Central, 25 minutes from Times Square (all in foot)
- Nicely renovated, feels 4 stars, three fast elevators
- Good beds, ironing board and iron in the room
- Wifi decently fast, large TVs in the rooms
- Late check out at 1pm was offered 

Cons:
- No walk-in showers, wash basins ridiculously low
- No cups for water while brushing teeth
- AC pretty noisy
- We didn't book breakfast, but there is no real breakfast room, only a few tables
- Parking for Ubers/taxis in front of the hotel not easy
- My room (ends in 14) had a "view" of a dark, narrow alley even though Nestor at reception said I'd like it 🙄

So, far from perfect, but this was one of the cheapest options in May and it was a decent experience overall.

Très bon accueil, malgré une erreur de ma part sur la réservation de la chambre (j'avais pris 1 lit double au lieu de 2 lits) . Ils nous ont changé de chambre et nous ont mis dans les meilleurs conditions pour bien dormir.
La literie est exceptionnelle, j'y ai passé mes meilleures nuits, tellement c'était confortable!
Chambre très propre et pratique.
L'hôtel est proche de toutes commodités, proche de la gare Grand central, a 15mn à pieds de Time Square. Bref je recommande vivement cet hôtel.

title: Idéal pour visiter New York
text:
Une déco et des équipements un peu surannée 
Un petit déjeuner avec système de vousher vraiment cheap même si ça réduit les coûts.
Ça c etait le négatif si on doit en trouver
Pour le reste ...situation idéale à 5 mn de Grand Central tout manathan accessible à pied.
3 photos prises à mons de 100m de l hôtel.
Propreté et personnel nickel.
Rapport qualité prix très favorable.
En clair si je cherche un Hôtel idéal pour NY je retourne au Wesgate.

title: Exellent hôtel
text:
Excellent séjour en famille dans cet hôtel.
Très bon accueil et personnel sympathique.
Très bon point pour la chambre vraiment spacieuse pour 4 avec deux grands lits. Très confortable et propre.
On a apprécié le petit déjeuner : grande boisson chaude et un sac avec eau jus d'orange banane gros muffin et yaourt. Complet.
L'hôtel est parfaitement situé : sur la 42e, qui est proche du coeur de Manhattan  (l'Empire State Building et la 5e avenue sont à dix minutes à pied). Malgré cela, nous étions parfaitement au calme dans la chambre, pas de bruit extérieur ni des autres chambres.
Très bonnes pizzas américaines pas chères et très bonnes à deux rues
Je ne vois pas de point négatif ! On a trouvé cet hôtel parfait pour notre semaine en plein coeur de New York.

title: Viaggio di gruppo con NEMEA VIAGGI
text:

title: Westgate New York Grand Central.....Awesome hotel!!!!
text: Let me start off by saying this hotel was Great!  My room was so beautiful and relaxing. I had access to the balcony and the views were excellent. I loved this hotel....Just wonderful!!! title: Very impressed
text:
Very impressed with this hotel. 
Stayed here for 13 nights on honeymoon.
Newly renovated, clean, bright lobby. Autumn/fall decorations were a nice touch! 
Doormen we’re very friendly and helpful, reception desk staff were always there and available. 
We stayed in a newly renovated room, it was lovely. Newly wood flooring, huge comfy bed, block out blinds. Room was surprisingly large. There was so much floor space around the bed even with two large suitcases, which was brilliant. Closet hanging space, safe and fridge. 
Bathroom was on the small size but would rather have a smaller bathroom and the extra space in the rest of the room. 
Room was cleaned daily so always stocked with clean bedding, towels and toiletries. 
Great location, walking distance to everything but a few blocks away from the noise so you felt it was a bit quieter. 
Small bar for guests and snacks/drinks/fruit available for purchase downstairs was great. 
We were out all day everyday sight seeing and being tourists so didn’t need any other amenities but to come back to a clean, comfy space was perfect. 
All in all I couldn’t fault the hotel, the price was really reasonable, especially for New York and for the space you get I was so surprised. 
Would definitely recommend.

title: Bon hôtel
text:
Bel hôtel, plutôt propre (petite surprise en arrivant le premier jour mais ensuite le ménage était correct) 
Il est bien situé, la gare est juste à côté. 

Petit bémol sur le petit déjeuner mais je pense que c’est un peu comme ça pour tous les hôtels de cette game à New York. 

La chambre était au calme, pas de bruit entendu provenant des autres chambres. Et peu de bruits extérieurs. 
Lit et chambre spacieux et confortables.

title: Parfait !
text: Accueil vraiment au top ! Nous avons rencontré des soucis de réservation, le personnel a su résoudre tous les problèmes de manière efficace. Très satisfaite du service. Mention particulière à Shafik qui nous a parfaitement bien conseillé et qui a su se rendre disponible chaque fois que nécessaire !

title: Great location, reasonably priced, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms.  All in all a nice hotel and stay.
text: We spent twenty nights at this hotel in March 2023.  The nightly rate was reasonable, the rooms were clean, beds comfortable and the location is excellent.  I wish they had a restaurant but the area where they sell drinks and packaged items was certainly helpful.  The staff, in particular the Bellmen were all super helpful and friendly.  Special shout out to Chafik, he went above and beyond for us repeatedly - very nice, professional and helpful person.  A+.  We had a family member with a wheelchair and each time we arrived and departed a Bellman had to help us - literally every single time they were prompt, helpful, friendly and accommodating.

title: Great location. Beautiful historic building.
text: Friendly staff. Freddy and Jose were extremely helpful and welcoming each morning. Great location close to transportation, restaurants, and shopping. Beautiful historic building in the Tudor City neighborhood. Quiet and clean rooms.

text:

title: Really great hotel!
text:
From the moment my car pulled up, a doorman grabbed my suitcase in the rain and ran with it to the front desk.  That was nice!!!  Seriously, the staff here is super nice, like "Disney-resort nice". 
    I checked in around 10:30 pm since my flight was heavily delayed.  The only downfall, this hotel is located on the East side, which is more upscale, but unfortunately that means your surrounded more by big corporate buildings and banks which didn't leave any late night places open for food. My dinner that night was trail mix I just happened to have on me.
   My room was lovely! It was very spacious and more outlets than any other hotel I've ever seen.  I LOVE that there was a mini fridge, and I LOVE that there were many mirrors, and gray lighting in the room.  The room seems freshly renovated, which also meant they were working on more rooms which meant construction noise from 9-4.  Ah, well.
   I go to NYC for Broadway shows, so it is a brisk walk to everything, but the hotel was so nice, I didn't mind the distance.  Plus I love to walk.
   The hotel has a great fitness center on the 2nd floor, which was well equipped. I wish I had time to use it more than once.
   The elevators are usually quick and not key card operated, which I like but other people may differ.  The staff always honored my privacy since I kept my sign on my door. And delivered the individual cup coffeemaker, since my room was missing one.
   I really loved staying here and can't wait to stay again!

title: Hotel and staff
text:

title: Personnel au top
text:

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: Typically, my business in New York is in mid-town. On this trip, I was going to be closer to Grand Central and more specifically around the corner from the Westgate New York Grand Central. So, I gave it a shot. Very glad I did. The service was exceptional -- friendly, attentive and informative. Check-in was quick, and the bellman was fast to offer a recommendation for a late dinner. The next morning was even better. My room was larger than a lot of NYC hotels, well-appointed and very comfortable. Great stay!

title: Perfect location, classy hotel.
text:
Outstanding Tudor City location on East 42nd Street in quiet, quaint beauty of a neighborhood. 
Public transportation convenience!  Real NY non-touristy feel. Would definitely stay again when we return to New York City.

title: Séjour avec 3 ados en février 2023
text: Bel hôtel, literie et chambre agréable, propre. La vue des 2 chambres étaient sur un mur à 10 mètres en face, mais ça a l'avantage d'être calme (par rapport à notre dernier séjour à Broadway). A 5 mn de l'ONU à visiter à tout prix ! Attention toutefois, l'hôtel annonce un parking gratuit pour les résidents, il n'est gratuit que si vous réservez directement par l'hôtel et non par un tour opérator (Carrefour pour nous), soit 115 dollars par nuit ! Chafik est super sympa et conseille très bien, Merci.

title: Staff was friendly :)!
text: the staff was really nice and helpful and after we checked out, let us keep our bags there until our flight. chafik was especially helpful he helped us with our bags when our cab came and was very friendly! would definitely come back and recommend :)

title: Perfectly Flawed!
text:
The artsy, boutique furnishings were hard to miss as I checked in. The reception staff was friendly and efficient. They required a $100 credit card deposit which, I was told, would be reversed at check-out, given there are no incidentals. 

Seamless. The 10th floor was quiet. My Luxe Queen room, though lacking in square footage, was so charming otherwise. Well appointed with fresh linens and aromatic toiletries, the icing on the cake was locating #friends on television. In the famous words of Chandler Bing, “could I be any…?”  The tidy, brightly lit bathroom, room darkening shades, comfortable bed, and the vintage-modern decor made for a cozy nook to grab solid sleep after dancing the night away. 

I asked reception about bottled water. As per my reservation, I was privy to two (2) complimentary bottles. This was great because there weren’t stores  nearby open late. Maybe in this neighborhood, gone are the days of the city that never sleeps. 

The coffee in the room was weak and the coffee machine was ancient. No worries, the lobby market had #starbucks. 

Last but certainly not least, what a bummer, the lobby and market closed unusually early for NYC. I was looking forward to a cocktail or two with my family at the end of the evening. Perhaps, the recovery post-pandemic is ongoing. #essentialworkers 

I cannot wait to return and enjoy an extended stay at the Westgate New York Grand Central!!

Happy travels.

title: Zero Customer Service
text: I made a reservation at this hotel through Nectar card points which I had been saving for 10 years.  I was visiting my daughter who was studying in New York, I did not realise my daughter lived 2 and half hours by bus outside of New York City so she would need to stay at the hotel with my husband and I.  Within 2 days of realising this I contacted the hotel direct and said can I pay for an upgrade so there are 2 beds in the room,  they said out right no as you have made the booking direct, but if a bigger room is available on check in we might let you upgrade.  I said this is no use to me I need to know as she is travelling after uni and I dont want here arriving in the evening and then not being able to stay,  they said I had to speak to Nectar which I did they rang the hotel several times and the hotel said no.  I said can I cancel an rebook then and pay for the larger room, they said no if you cancel you lose the room and the points,  in the end I had no option but to cancel and lose the points 111,000 of them.  I have never heard of a hotel which won't let you upgrade terrible customer service and I will never book or recommend this hotel as they literally will do nothing to help you!

text:

text: Worst hotel experience ever. Booked weeks in advance. On arrival, I am told it’s overbooked and asked to go to another hotel as they have made a booking for me for 1 night. I get to the hotel and they know nothing about the booking. At this point, i walked back to original hotel and was told it’s sorted and I proceed to make my 2nd trip to hotel #2. They confirm a 1 night reservation and I am asked to pay the new hotel. I obviously refused as I have paid for my reservation. Was stuck and stranded for hours. Being made to walk up and down in the cold with luggage early hours of the morning between 2 hotels

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel , très bon accueil, chambre propres 
Le personnel est chaleureux , voyageant avec ma sœur et ma nièce , il nous a été proposé des chambres adjacentes 
Les petits déjeuners sous forme de box sont complets avec boisson chaude et peuvent être pris au bar cafétéria de l hôtel

title: AVOID, a 3 star dressed as a 4 star with 2 star service
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and 2 of them were not great due to the cold in the room and bathroom. Slept in a “sweat suit” on our 1st night as it was so cold. Overall experience from moment 1, checked in and there were 2 staff at the registration desk, as I walked up and waited form them to finish their conversation, not big deal but when I got their attention, it was poor at best as they continued to speak to each other in Spanish as if I was not there. 
Went to the room, small dark room, and cold. Could not get the room up over 66 degrees till late on my second day and the bathroom had no heat and a large external window, granted it was a cold NY weekend, but the bathroom was freezing till I insisted on a portable heater in the bathroom for my last 3 nights. 
Dealt with the lobby area on the cold and they were useless. The manager, Jeter, was rude and ignorant and said it would get sorted even thought I had highlighted the cold room and bathroom more than once. This guy should be trained on how to talk to customers. 
We asked for shower caps to be told there were none in the hotel, they managed to get us two. I asked for glasses to drink water out off in the room and cups for the coffee machine to be told they give plastic cups since Covid; mind you they serve beer in the bar in glasses. Go figure.
Bar area is a little sad. This is not a hotel one wants to hang out in after a long day being a tourist. 
This is NOT a four star hotel, it is a 3 at best and just about.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Hotel in ottima posizione sulla 42nd. Fermata del bus davanti all’hotel. Personale simpatico e disponibile in particolare i portieri sempre pronti a farvi un favore.
Camere molto carine e letti molto comodi.
Purtroppo la colazione non è all’altezza delle aspettative. Non fidatevi delle foto che vedete qui: la sala da pranzo/colazione non esiste più e come buona parte degli hotel di New York ora la colazione consiste in un sacchetto di carta contenente un caffè, uno yogurt, una brioche sottovuoto e una banana. Un vero peccato per noi che sognavamo una mega colazione per poter tenere buona parte della giornata a visitare NYC.
Se volete fare colazione andate in uno dei tanti LE PAIN QUOTIDIEN sparsi in città. Non a buon mercato ma troverete buon caffè, veri croissants e altre piccole delizie.

Comunque un ottimo soggiorno che raccomandiamo.

title: Great staff, average hotel
text: The “newly” renovated rooms were average. The room was pretty small and the bathroom could have been updated. The windows were very drafty and the shower drained very slowly. They gave us 1 coffee pod for the three of us and didn’t replace it the next day so had to call both days for them to stock it up. The bar/market place are only open certain times of the day which was disappointing. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly, but the best part of the stay were the doormen. Especially Freddy. They were very welcoming, so friendly and very helpful. They by far made coming and going the best part of the stay!

title: Super hotel
text:

Le petit déjeuner sous forme de sachet est très complet. Sans hésiter nous retournerons dans cet hôtel lors d un prochain voyage à NY

title: Perfect Place to Stay!
text:
Great service! From the moment we arrived with the car and Jose the doorman greeted us, it was all good. Jose was quick to take our bags and politely informed us how the parking situation works. While we waited on a long line to check-in, Jose offered those of us online a bottle of water. We were all grateful and the mood of everyone improved immediately. Later that evening, he was quick to help us grab a cab.
The rooms my group stayed in were luxurious for NYC. These suites and their balconies were very clean and impressive. Upon checking out, we needed to leave our bags. The bellman Chafik (spelling?) was very sincere and kind as he helped us organize our belongings. Later that evening when we needed our car returned, Jose and Chafik worked smoothly to collect the car and belongings in the freezing temps.
We found plenty of new coffee shops and restaurants in the area- making the location of this hotel ideal for someone wanting to be close to Times Square but not in it. We walked often because everything was so close. And it was nice to end the night with a drink from the bar- the sitting area is ample and a great place to relax with friends. 
The amazing staff, clean rooms, and great location means, we will be back!

title: La excelencia
text: Nueva York es mi top de las 3 ciudades mas maravillosas, cada lugar es especial, pero lo que uno descubre cada viaje, es nuevo y maravilloso, hay que disfrutar esta experiencia, siempre cuidándonos pues sigue siendo una urbe complicada. Súper atracción.

title: Jenkins Plummer Ny weekend
text:
We had the best experience with this hotel. The accommodations were wonderful. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, bathroom was also very nice. 
I can’t say enough about the staff. So courteous and accommodating. Very attentive. Big shout out to
Chafik and Jose. We couldn’t have asked for anything more. 
We will definitely be booking this hotel again for our December trip this year.

title: Great Location in Manhattan NYC
text:
Stayed 5 nights in this hotel for new year celebration. Nice hotel located in central Manhattan, within walking distance to so many attractions - Time Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State Building etc. Hotel is newly renovated, neat and clean throughout. Rooms are meticulously services everyday and any requirements for additional towels, water or coffee are promptly met. Staff are very professional and polite. My only complaint is that initially we were put in Luxe Queen Room which is only 200 sq ft with a door to adjoining room. We could clearly hear our neighbours. There was water dripping in the bathroom from upper floor. Once we talked to reception, we were quickly moved to Luxe Queen Suite which is far more spacious - more than 400 sq ft - and is very quiet and comfortable. Apart from initial hiccups, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel.
Many thanks to Luis and Nester for providing prompt professional service to make our stay enjoyable!

title: Birthday Trip
text: This was our first time to New York. We went for my daughters birthday so it was a special trip. We booked this because it had good reviews and was in close proximity to several things. Bed was comfortable. Rooms were small but we expected that.  Loved the decor. “Woman in Gold” is a favorite of mine and it was all over the hotel. We were exhausted when we got there about an hour before check in. Vito at the front desk was very helpful. Our room was ready so we didn’t have to wait. He sent us on up. Jose the doorman was awesome. Very helpful and friendly. The staff at the bar were super too. There were a few issues but nothing major. There was an issue with our safe. It had a battery message on it and I asked for them to replace it but they didn’t. I didn’t ask again but I hated we couldn’t lock our stuff up. We were too busy to mess with it so I just took stuff with me. Also, when we left I had a 90$ charge for the market place that we didn’t make. They had put another rooms purchase on ours. They fixed it but I had to spend a morning trying to get someone to help me.  Would definitely stay here again though. We had a blast in New York and we will be back.

title: Great NYC Sisters Trip!
text: My sister and I went to New York City to celebrate her 60th birthday and had a blast!  The Westgate New York Grand Central was conveniently located about a mile from Times Square so we were close but not in the heart of the City!  Our stay was made especially nice due to our doorman Jose, who went above and beyond every day to make us feel welcome with his recommendations for food and sightseeing!  Doorman Jose worked tirelessly every day and worked very long hours but still had a smile and time for a conversation about how our day was!  I highly recommend staying at the Westgate New York Grand Central and I hope Jose the Doorman is working because he is a breath of fresh air!

When I called they said they recovered nothing from my room despite leaving straight from the room with a closed luggage. Disappointing but I guess lesson learned. Just don't leave anything expensive behind and expect to get it back.

Great location on east 42nd street literally a 2 min walk to grand central and 10 mins from rockerfella centre! Would definitely recommend

title: Great Hotel in Great location
text: Lovely hotel in great location. Great for Grand Central Station. Stayed in Luxe Queen Room on 4th floor lovely and quiet. Staff very helpful and Jose the doorman so helpful and knowledgeable. I would recommend this hotel and will return without hesitation when visiting New York again.

title: Vacances
text:

title: Great location, awful management
text:
There appears to be absolutely zero coordination between the Westgate New York Grand Central hotel and Westgate’s headquarters in Florida. I booked a reservation at the New York Grand Central (previously Tudor Hotel) at which point I was required to provide a credit card for holding the reservation. My parents were going to pay for my fiancé and my stay at the hotel, so we used their credit card to hold the reservation. However, the website states that you apparently need to have the card with you in-person upon checking-in for your stay. I called what appeared to be the number for the hotel lobby and it appeared to be for one of the Florida offices. I was able to finally get connected to someone at the lobby (I think) when they asked me for my reservation number. I had received a confirmation email with a couple different numbers, but NONE of them were apparently the reservation number. I even created an account on their website and logged in to try to find the reservation number, but you need the reservation number to add your reservation! The front-desk lady was able to find my reservation number which I then wrote down on some paper and was finally able to enter that into the website successfully to see my reservation. After this I got bounced around to multiple people until I was finally connected with someone who was able to answer my questions. The man I was connected with, who was a manager I believe, said that we couldn’t pay in advance but that we could use their card as long as I had my parents submit a credit card authorization form to them including a scan of their driver’s license but explicitly NOT of the credit card. My mom filled out their form and submitted it along with the front-and-back scan of her driver’s license. Upon doing this she confirmed with them that they had everything they needed, and they assured her that they did and that we were good to go and wouldn’t need to have the credit card with us when checking in.

With all the back-and-forth, I had a really bad feeling that something was going to happen and cause us issues, but we had done everything that we had been told to do so there was nothing to be done but get there and hope for the best. Well, after a full day of flying across the country on empty-stomachs and a two-hour drive with an insane Lyft driver in the middle of peak rush-hour traffic, we FINALLY arrived at the hotel in one piece. The bellhop put our things on a card and my fiancé sat in the lobby while I checked in at the front desk. I gave them my name and they proceeded to tell me that they did not, in fact, have what they needed from us in order to charge my parent’s credit card and allow us to check in to our room. I explained how we filled out the form as directed and provided everything we were told to provide and I showed them the email messages too. I ended up having to have my mom get on the phone to hash everything out with them. I was very polite, though very matter of fact, the entire time even though I was exhausted and very frustrated because I knew it wasn’t the fault of the front-desk person, Kevin Law. Kevin, me, and my mom worked back and forth for probably an hour or two at least before finally we were able to get things sorted including having to have my mom send a back-and-front scan of her credit card against her wishes. Due to the frustration and issues, Kevin graciously upgraded our room from a queen suite to a king suite and give us a bit of a discount as well as a bottle of wine. Kevin was very professional the entire time as was all of the staff at the actual hotel, but the sheer insanity and lack of coordination between the headquarters and the actual hotels is mind-boggling.

After the fever-dream of the day and the nightmare of checking in, our stay was actually quite pleasant. The room was really nice (especially with the upgrade) and the staff were very pleasant also. The balcony was especially nice and had an amazing view! The room was still on the smaller side, without even a microwave and only a very small mini-fridge and desk, but for mid-town Manhattan it was pretty big and nice for the price.

The ATM by the elevators ate my card the first time I tried to use it, so I had to go talk to the front desk and they said it had been having issues but it would eventually spit my card back out. We seriously waited for like 5 minutes before it finally gave me back my card after I had hit cancel. They ended up taping an “out of order” paper on it for a couple of days until I noticed it was no longer there. At that point though we were usually in a rush and I didn’t want to risk having my card eaten again…

After the first day or so, the shower started backing up very badly and would take forever to finally drain, leaving a really gross residue in the shower. We called up the front-desk to have someone check it out and the repair guy was kind of aggressive and started blaming the cleaning people. He tried clearing out the drain and it looked like it would work, but again it still backed up really badly, at which point we just dealt with it.

I get it that it’s New York City, but the room doesn’t have that great of sound-proofing. At night you can still hear the sounds of the city like sirens fairly loudly, and throughout the day on the days we stayed in our room, you could hear this one construction worker across the street shouting as if he was being stabbed every couple of minutes.

On a much less important but still worth mentioning note, the Tudor City Tavern and Tudor City Marketplace are not nearly as impressive as they are made to look. The marketplace has a couple things, but I’ve seen more selection at a Hotel 8 in the middle of nowhere in Texas. We didn’t really get a chance to try the tavern, but it is only a couple seats and one guy working it. Both also have semi-limited schedules and the microwaves are in the marketplace area so when they close it down you aren’t able to microwave anything since there aren’t microwaves in the room. There is luckily a 24-hour CVS just a block or two away, but it would still be nice to have a bit more options in the hotel and also to have the microwaves either in the room or outside of the locked-off area for late-night eaters.

Epilogue
The reservation and backend-management side of things is utterly f@$#ed and the hotel is lacking some of the more basic oft’ taken-for-granted amenities, but the hotel staff was really nice (besides the repair guy) and the hotel was pretty decent for the cost and the great location. It would be nice to have some better amenities for the price, though.

P.S. The telephone in the hotel suite has some button presets including one for the front-desk which would be nice except that, once again, it sends you to someone in Florida!!! Why? Just why?!

text:
Ho soggiornato in questa struttura ad ottobre con mio marito in occasione del nostro viaggio di nozze.
Albergo situato a pochi passi dalla fermata del pullman e a pochi metri dalla fermata della metro.

Hall decorata con elementi caratteristici dell’autunno.

text: Our stay at the Westgate was made extra special from the moment of check in by Kevin Law and Nestor Carillon at the front desk. We were given a room with a balcony facing the East River and it was lovely. Very comfortable bed. Good water pressure in the shower. Nice bar. Great breakfast/bagel spot around the corner. Doable walk to the Theater District. Overall a wonderful stay!

text: J’ai séjourné dans cet hôtel du 23 au29 octobre, dès le départ on nous demande une caution normalement de 50 dollars non débités et 2 jours plus tard on s’aperçoit que 1500 dollars on été débité sur notre compte! 30 fois la caution !!! text: Très belle hôtel, chambre très jolie et propre. Personnel très gentils a l’accueil ! nous avons eu affaire à José et Chafik pour le taxi c’était parfait rien à dire ils nous on prévenu de l’arrivée de notre taxi et pris nos bagage pour les mettre dans la voiture on a rien eu à gérer ! text: Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel durant 6 nuits, accueil parfait du personnel, un verre nous a même été offert le premier soir. La chambre quadruple était spacieuse et très propre. Tous les matins la femme de chambre s'occupait de tout remettre en ordre, mention spéciale pour la personne qui a fait un éléphant avec les serviettes de bain ! Le petit déjeuner était correct, servi dans une box nous pouvions échanger lorsque cela ne convenait pas à nos goûts. Le personnel du bar était très sympathique et également Mr Chafik qui a été aux petits soins durant tout le séjour et qui parle français. title: Séjour parfait à NYC
text: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour, l’hôtel est bien situé à 20 minutes à pied de Times square, les chambres sont propres et le personnel agréable et disponible surtout Chafik qui parle très bien le Français. Nous recommandons cet hôtel.

title: Excellent service
text: My friend and I booked a 4 night break at this fantastic hotel. We were met on our arrival by Jose the doorman who looked after us every day. He could not do enough for us. When he was not there, his colleague Chafik took over. All the staff at the reception desk, bar and housekeeping staff were first class. Such a friendly hotel. We are planning another trip in December 2023 and will certainly be staying at the Westgate. Thank you everyone.

title: Near Grand Central Station
text:
Beautiful hotel near Grand Central Station . 
As soon as my husband and I arrived the doorman came to help with our suitcases . 
Such a warm and friendly welcome at the reception too . 
Our room had a queen sized bed , well lite , mirrors , and toiletries and wooden floor . Spotlessly clean room and had the best nights sleep in a long time after a long journey from the UK . 
Lovely hot shower over the bath and cosy towels and dressing gown . 
Beautiful decorated and lovely bar area . Also there are snacks for you to purchase for breakfast as room only . 
My only negative is the additional daily  charges that are mandatory and unexpected in NYC !! 
Here in the UK the rate you make on booking is the total cost unless you ask for additional extras . 
The £30 dollars per day should be on the room rate so you don’t have any unexpected surprises. 
Other than that I’d definitely stay here again .

title: Clean hotel
text: Hotel was really clean, nicely decorated and not a bad size for New York. Apart from checking in, we didn't have any interaction with staff, so cannot comment on how friendly they were. If you leaned out the window, we had a great view of 42nd Street and the Crysler building. A few negatives,  our bed was comfy enough once you were in it and very big but it was a fold out and because of the arms on the the sofa bed, you had to get it in it lower down and climb up the bed, also couldn't reach a lamp or plug from my side of the bed, due to the frame. I maybe should have asked for a change but it was comfy once we got in it. The room had a connecting door to another room and when it was occupied there was no privacy - would be ideal for a family though.

title: Would definitely recommend
text: My husband and I just returned from a three night (weekend) stay at this hotel. I would highly recommend  it. All the staff were very friendly and kind.  Clean hotel and as soon as you walk into the lobby,  a great scent.  Beds were comfortable.  The washroom tub/shower could use a refreshing but not a big deal. Great location as well. Not to busy but in close walking distance to everything. We would definitely return.

text: We went as part of a package cruise with Imagine cruising who were not good on this one. The hotel staff stepped up and helped in various ways. An oil filled electric heater was supplied to our room after the first very cold night on the top floor. All the lobby staff were very supportive and helpful, especially Chafik who organised our transport retuning to the ship in Brooklyn. The food availability was not so good with a bar only open at certain times - thank goodness for the supermarket we were told were round the corner and the cafes very local.

Fanny et Benjamin Noel

title: Très bien
text:
Hotel situé proche du Chrysler Building et de l'ONU. Une station de métro est à 5/6 minutes à pieds.
Hotel de bon standing, bien rénové, très propre. Personnel sympathique et efficace. Dispose d'une bagagerie vous permettant de laisser la valise avant le retour à l'aéroport. Peut également réserver le taxi ou navette aéroport.
Chambre : située à un étage bas sans vue mais donnant sur cour et petite rue résidentielle donc sans bruit ce qui est appréciable. Peu de circulation. Très bonne isolation phonique. Chambre très propre et rénovée. Salle de bain propre et eau chaude très rapidement. Bonne taille.
Des supermarchés sont situés aux alentours.
Je recommande cet établissement. Nous avons acheté via venteprivée, aucune surtaxe à payer sur place. Prix compétitif avec la promotion. Toutefois reste trop cher en tarif sans ristourne.

title: Good hotel well placed in NY
text: Good hotel next to the empire state building. Not far from metro station and time square. Little fitness room available to do some gym. Ask for Chalik for a french support in the hotel ! He will for sure help you.

title: Good overall
text: Overall a good stay in a central Manhatten hotel. My bed was super comfy,  All staff were great at their job and really helpful. The carpets in the hallways looked plush. I especially liked the barman who was genuine and friendly. A few things weren't great. The fruit sold in the market was soft and not fresh.  Most of all,  from my 3rd night it became crystal clear that I had neighbours.  Without them being noisy we may as well have had just a curtain separating us. I could hear every word and movement like they were right next to me. This was concerning and off putting especially hearing discriminatory language from them. What should you do in that situation?? In Central Manhatten of course its not going to be quiet but this was difficult as my privacy felt lost. I want to be supportive of the hotel so am keen to highlight the positives too but this 1 issue left a lasting impression on me of my time here.

text:

Situato sulla 42 tra la Grand Station e palazzo delle Nazioni Unite .

text: My mom booked this hotel thinking it would have full service amenities especially for the price that we paid. There is no hot food, well possible food you can heat up in the microwave. title: Jose the Doorman was AMAZING!!

title: Nice time in NYC

The location was great, close to the subway, on the bus line, several good eating places nearby as was Time Square. I would definitely return and highly recommend it.

title: lost my reservation and then had no towels
text: I have never written a bad review of a hotel before but I don't want anyone else to have my experience. My office's travel agent booked 2 rooms for me and a colleague- and I got a confirmation. When we arrived, there was only one room reserved and we were told there was nothing else available- the front desk clerk asked if me and my male colleague could share a room! I ended up taking a taxi out to friends in NJ. The following night I stayed at the hotel (because my colleague was there) and in the morning I went to the gym, got undressed to shower and realized there were no bath towels in the room. I called downstairs and 10 minutes later called back and then 5 minutes later called again! I ended up showering and drying myself off with face towels. When I complained about both issues to the manager, she apologized and blamed the room snafu on my travel agent.

title: Séjour parfait

Personnels sympathiques et très accueillants, surtout Kévin à l'accueil. Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cette hôtel, je le recommande vivement.

title: Westgate Grand Central 5 night stay August 2022
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights on my first ever trip to NYC this past August - my husband and I went with my brother and sister-in-law who had also never been.

We requested rooms close to one another and we were originally on the same floor, but we had to be moved 2 hours into our stay because we were given a connecting room (see: ZERO noise dampening) beside a rowdy bachelorette party.

Our new room was 2 floors down and fine for the first few days. We didn't get washcloths despite my asking several times. We were given a new set of towels when I requested washcloths that didn't include washcloths, only two new towels. The towels in the room were all tattered and coming apart and had holes in them.

My brother's room had a view of a brick wall. We had a slightly better view of a different brick wall.

We weren't given coffee one morning, and when I requested more from the front desk we never received it.

Then our A/C went out and maintenance was in our ceiling at 11:00 pm trying to fix it. They couldn't and said we'd have to change rooms AGAIN. This time they tried to move us to an entirely different tower, even though we told them we wanted to stay close to the family we were travelling with. 

Upon seeing how far away this was, we decided to stay put as we were only there for 2 more nights. It was scorching that week in NYC - temps in the 30 degrees celsius range - we really needed that AC!

Finally, our bathtub was clogged and every time you took a shower it backed up and filled halfway with water. 

The staff was nice, even though we had so many challenges with this property. I have left 3 follow-ups on the various surveys I was asked to fill out after my stay asking for at minimum my resort fee of $30+ USD a day to be refunded (what did I get for the resort fee? Just wi-fi, no AC, no coffee, no amenities?) and have yet to receive a response. I sent an email with this request as well and have not received a response.

We've travelled all over the world and this hotel was easily one of our most frustrating experiences because of the multitude of small frustrating details that were easily fixed.

I am not satisfied with my stay at this property and if it's your first trip to NYC I recommend you stay somewhere else!
