text: From the moment you arrive to the hotel Jose the doorman came and greeted me ask if he can help with my bags! The staff was very friendly! Drinks at yje bar were amazing! I recommend this place! Nice.

title: The best hotel in Manhattan with the best staff Jose
text: We recently visited this hotel for the 7th time (the first time post Covid) and I really can say that it just keeps getting better each time. The renovations to the hotel are superb. The rooms are clean and spacious and the upgrades are excellent. When we arrived it was lovely to see such amazing staff who alway greet you with a friendly smile. The check in process was fast and efficient and our bags were quickly taken to our room. The bar area is warm and welcoming and we enjoyed going for a drink at the bar after a long day around Manhattan. A massive shoutout goes to Jose the Bell man. Nothing was ever too much trouble and he always went out it of his way to go that extra mile. He really is amazing and a true ambassador for the hotel and the Westgate brand. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan as it truly is the best and it is staff like Jose that makes it that way. I am already counting down the days until I can return.

title: Wonderful hotel and location
text:
Fabulous hotel in a great location!
Staff were helpful and friendly, I was upgraded to a room with a balcony( no extra charge)
I was a single lady travelling alone and felt very safe with this hotel and location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Chafik you are the best!!! Signed the Ben Saad french family
text: Fabulous stay at this ideally located hotel ! We ( family Ben Saad with 4 teen-agers) highly recommend : thank you Hedi for your kindness and these great moments at the breakfast,  thank you Christina at the office, you were so helpfull and efficient, and a special big up to Chafik and José the best employees ever who brillantly succeeded in repairing our taxi shuttle (Eddy) for the airport 🙏🥳😂😂😂👌

title: Great location, fantastic staff
text: I have been very impressed by the friendly and helpful staff at this hotel. They made our stay very nice and comfortable. I have no words to thank them all from the reception staff to the doormen, concierge, and cleaning staff. All were very friendly and found ways to accommodate all our requests.

title: Great find in midtown NYC
text: Lots and lots of hotel options in midtown. This was close enough to the action but far from Times Square that wasn't too expensive. You can see all the nice touches from their recent renovations. Rooms are spacious, and very comfy bed and pillows. Love the fridge in the nightstand. All the hotel staff were extremely nice and accommodating. The resort fee is a bummer but all NYC hotels charge this. I appreciate them giving customers their best rate directly from their website and you can cancel up to 24hrs if needed which is nice to have. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Best stay in the city!
text:
My stay at the Westgate was amazing! Nestor was very nice and helpful. I appreciate him a lot. 
José, the doorman was incredibly helpful and so nice! Tony was also really nice. They both looked out for me and ensured  I had what I needed. José got me a water after a long day out in the sun. Both offered to get me cabs whenever I went out.  If you stay there, look for Tony and José, who always had a great attitude. 
The hotel itself is beautiful, the room Nestor gave us was very comfortable and had a balcony with a great view. I can’t wait to come back! 
Im a Westgate owner in Orlando and they’re good.I have to say though that the service here was absolutely amazing, and everyone went above and beyond to make our short stay feel special.

title: Unlauteres Geschäftsgebaren
text: Nach langem Flug endlich im Hotel. Buchung sagte eindeutig das Booking Fee inkludiert war. Trotzdem wollte das Hotelpersonal uns nicht einchecken, falls wir die Kosten nicht tragen würden. Unmögliches Verhalten. Kann solche Geschäftspraktiken nicht billigen.

title: Très bon hôtel !
text: Un magnifique hôtel, très bien situé pour visiter New York. Les chambres sont très propres et insonorisées. On n’entend que très peu le bruit de « la ville qui ne dort jamais » et on dort bien. La literie est exceptionnelle. Le personnel est très sympathique et accueillant. Je recommande cet établissement sans hésiter ! On y a passé un excellent séjour.

title: Séjour parfait
text: Hôtel idéalement situé les chambres sont spacieuses et la literie est confortable sans parler du personnel toujours aux petits soins. Nous avons été ravis de notre séjour. Une mention spéciale pour Chafik qui est d'une gentillesse incroyable. On reviendra à coup sûr dans cet hôtel à notre prochain séjour à New-York.

title: Comfortable stay and staff was nice especially Chafik
text:
In June 2022, I visited the hotel with a group.  It was interesting that non of our 5 rooms were the same.  The rooms were comfortable and pretty basic.  But the rooms were clean and the staff was nice. Chafik stands out for being extra helpful.
The only issue was the the website let us book a 2 bedroom suite and when we arrived the hotel staff informed us there were no such suite in the hotel.

title: Nice trip in New york
text:
The hotel was nice and well ocated. The guestroom was little small but confortable.  We regretted that there is no restaurant in this hotel. The Market place has not a lot of things to offer and it  was very expensive. The personal was kind and competent. Special mention to Chafik, the janitor. We thank him because he helped us for reserving a taxi. And he speaks french, it was cool for us. We thanks also José who helped us with our luggage. We recommended thid hotel in NYC

Mohamed and Isabelle

title: A Must Stay
text: A Must Stay!! Great staff, location, and hotel! Check-in was quick. The staff members were professional, attentive, and kind! I recommend that you upgrade to a room with a balcony. It's worth it! I will be returning and recommending it!!!!

title: Great Location being basically 20 mins walk to Icons
text: Location was perfect and hotel clean and well managed. Being basically 20 minutes walk to Grand Central Terminal, United Nations, Time Square, Broadway and 5th Ave to Central Park etc...Takeaway Food was within a block.

title: Parfait sur toute la ligne
text:
Hôtel très bien placé, à 15 mn à pied de time square et de la  5ème avenue, proche de grand central. chambre très propre et non bruyante ! personnel sympa, un  grand merci à Chafik  surtout qui est très accueillant, bienveillant et  nous a  bien aidé durant notre séjour, (il parle français) sans hésiter si nous revenons sur New York ce sera ici. 
Bon a savoir également, les chambres sont équipées de sèche cheveux, produit pour le Corps et cheveux, de fer à repasser et d un coffre. 
Ne vous embêtez pas avec votre trousse de toilette.

title: We really enjoyed our stay in New York at the Westgate
text: Everything was clean, the staff was very friendly and everything was handled according to our wishes. We can recommend the Westgate and would come again next time. Jose the doorman was especially friendly and helpful.

title: Good choice for Manhattan hotel.
text: Excellent location; great price. Half mile walk to Grand Central (subways) and Times Square. But, far enough away for a quiet night. The resort fee is the lowered star rating… what resort, guys? However, good, large-ish room, clean, good amenities, helpful people (especially Jose the bellhop).

title: A refaire Sans hésitation
text:
Très bon accueil malgré une Erreur de réservation de notre voyagiste
Très bonne réactivité pour nous trouver deux chambres en urgence 
Un immense merci pour Dormann Jose et son acolyte Denis pour nous avoir aidé avec le transfert du retour pour l’aéroport ce n’était pas gagné Mais  sommes arrivés à l’heure
Hôtel très bien situé

title: I was a first time guest May 30 - June 3 2022.
text:
As was a first-time hotel guest May 30 -June 3, 2022,  I shared a pleasant 2 queen room and a spacious bathroom with a travel companion. The room, while not large, was very clean and adequately comfortable. 
My review is a sincere thank you to hotel staff: in particular Jose the Doorman, Dennis the Bell Man, Chirstina at Reception and Jamie in the cafe.
Jose and Dennis seemed genuinely glad to see us return in the evenings and made us feel welcome, attentive without hovering, anticipating what we needed.
Christina was most accommodating to our requests, generous with helpful information answering our tourist questions. Jamie was very amiable and kept a busy cafe efficient (grab and go food, not breakfast) and quick to serve lots of hotel guests in the early a.m..
Overall, a terrific location ((42 St and Third) and a great stay away from home.

title: Westgate New York Grand Central Experience
text:
Excellent property and very convenient to Times Square. The valet/doorman (Jose), was pleasant and extremely helpful. Mr. Jose provided high quality customer service. Please give him a reward. 

The Property is clean and has a fantastic old time charm.

Overall, I had a great experience with the Westgate New York Grand Central NY; staff was incredibly helpful (Doorman) and the amenities were great.

title: Sleepless at Westgate Grand Central in N.Y.C.
text: This hotel has upgraded rooms, however, our 4-night stay in May 2022 was not a pleasant experience.  We stayed in a room that was $400+ per night. There were sounds of knocks, bangs and other unidentifiable sounds intermittently throughout the night causing sleepless nights.  Complaints were made to the front desk who offered another room after our second night.  The room was located one floor below and more spacious, however, the noises persisted.  After further inquiry, one of the front desk personnel admitted that there had been issues with the air conditioning system for the past several weeks!  It was surmised, but not fully known, that the A/C system was the source of the noises. We were also told that the building is 95 years old which was perceived as an excuse for some of the building noises.  Nonetheless, we were offered approximately 16% discount off our entire bill, far less than was expected and requested.  An on-line hotel survey was completed upon request.  Days later, a "boilerplate" type response was emailed by the front desk manager who apologized for our experience.  The likelihood of returning without further refund compensation is zero chance.

title: NYC Visit
text: I had a great stay at this hotel and staff was very friendly and welcoming. José, the doorman, was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the local areas! He went over and beyond to make our stay wonderful. Definitely will stay here on my next trip in New York City.

title: Très bonne expérience
text: Je recommande cette hôtel. Bien situé . Pas trop près mais pas loin du tout de toutes les attractions ( métro a 5mim a pied) Calme. Ont entend a peine le bruit de la rue . Et surtout très bien reçu. Nous avons été reçu par Monsieur Chafik( concierge) qui à était génial avec nous.Il parle très bien le français bien que vivant ici depuis beaucoup d'années. Merci Westgate et surtout merci monsieur Chafik

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Spent the weekend in NYC and this location was a great place to stay.  Conveniently located, clean, and rooms were very comfortable.  Jose, the Doorman, elevated our stay there - he was always on hand offering his assistance with care and a great attitude!  Would definitely return (and hope to see Jose again)!

title: Hôtel charmant et idéalement situé
text:
La rénovation de l'hôtel est superbe, les chambres style Tudor sont vraiment très bien décorées et plutôt spacieuses pour NYC! pour notre part, comme nous avions réservé tardivement la notre était sans vue (4ème étage) et plus petite mais déjà très agréable! si vous le pouvez n'hésitez pas à prendre une chambre double ou avec balcon! Le service est parfait, il y a une cafetière/théière, un coffre, un mini frigo ainsi qu'un fer à repasser et une planche et un VRAI sèche-cheveux (pas un souffleur)! ce que nous avons beaucoup apprécié ! La literie est excellente et surtout on apprécie grandement le calme du quartier la nuit ! seul bémol peut-être il n'y a qu'un plafonnier à la douche, pas de pommeau, mais c'est vraiment un détail
Le bar du lobby est agréable et le tudor market permet de dépanner le soir si vous n'avez pas pu acheter à manger. Tout le personnel est très serviable et toujours aux petits soins, une pensée particulière à Chafik qui parle très bien français (et beaucoup d'autres langues comme discuté avec lui !) et qui nous a gentiment réservé notre taxi pour le retour. Vous êtes adorable :) 
L'hôtel est idéalement situé, à quelques mètres de Grand Central et avec vue sur le Chrysler Building. Vous pouvez donc rejoindre le métro facilement mais également la Fifth ou Times Square à pieds. Je vous conseille d'utiliser le bus M42 qui s'arrête juste devant l'hôtel et à chaque avenue tout le long de la 42ème, de l'ONU jusqu'au Pier d'où partent les croisières Circle Line (Bryant Park, fifth, Times Square...) très très pratique ! Et comme indiqué plus haut, non seulement l'hôtel est proche de tout mais surtout il est au calme pour la nuit, aspect non négligeable (pour avoir déjà dormi dans les alentours de Times Square et ne pas avoir réussi à fermer l'oeil...)
Il y a effectivement des taxes de séjour mais cela est normal et c'est pareil dans tous les hôtels des USA, rassurez vous 
En bref, je recommande cet hôtel les yeux fermés et je retournerai sans hésitation au Westgate pour mon prochain séjour à NYC ! merci à tout le personnel de nous avoir permis avec ma maman de passer un merveilleux séjour ! see you soon !!

title: José the doorsuperman
text: José the doorsuperman went above and beyond for me and my family without any hesitation! He made us feel like we were top priority and relentlessly enhanced our family trip each and EVERYDAY. I’m so lucky to have met him.

title: En vacances
text:
Westgate new york, fantastique, personnel d'hôtel très très professionnel et très sympathique. Nous comptons vraiment y retourner. Bravo et nous avons très bien aimé et apprécié.
A bientôt.

J'avais complètement oublié de remercier l'excellent Vitto pour sa grande disponibilité à tous les moments pendant notre séjour.
Une mention très spéciale va à Germaine pour sa grande et remarquable gestion de ce grand hôtel.
A très bientôt.

title: Great midtown Manhattan option
text: Our balcony room presented as it was described.   We arrived early and were pleasantly surprised that we were allowed to check in at that time.  The front desk and housekeeping teams were delightful.  At check out, doormen Jose and Chafin were phenomenal in allowing us to store our baggage and pre-arranging our transportation to the airport, allowing a relaxing last day in the city.  We will absolutely return on our next trip to NYC.

title: May babies girls trip
text: First time in NYC and we made the best choice. Everyone was great from check in to check out. Great hospitality especially the concierge Mr. Chafik.  Love this place close to restaurants, shopping and more

title: Clean, updated rooms and comfortable beds!
text: Visited NYC for our 50th anniversary....so glad we stayed at the Westgate! Our room was SO quiet, the bed was very comfortable and we had plenty of space. The staff was very friendly, helpful and always smiling. Location was great - we were able to walk to so many restaurants and sights -- Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, Times Square, Hudson Yards. Easy subway ride to the Statue of Liberty and Wall Street area. The very clean bathroom was roomy, had plenty of counterspace, very good lighting, a magnifying mirror and a hair dryer. Loved the floors - herring bone wood floors felt extra clean. Having a minifridge, iron and ironing board and a spacious closet were nice extras.

title: Location, location, location
text: We ended up on an impromptu trip to NYC when another trip fell through. We were able to book this hotel at the last minute for a reasonable price. The top 10 reasons to stay at this hotel are location, location, location...(you get the idea). Easy walk to NYC public library, UN, grand central, times square, Hudson yards, etc.  Just awesome. The hotel itself is fairly historic (could be a euphemism for old and tired) but was clean and the rooms are comfortable - they are spacious by NYC standards. We had a bad experience with a terrible bartender at the small bar area and the front desk clerk said he would discuss with manager. No one ever contacted us. Ultimately, it was a good enough place at an amazing location at a good price.

title: Ottima Location
text: Ottimo hotel vicino a Grand Central station. Supermercato nelle vicinanze. Belle camere personale gentile. Ho prenotato con un'offerta molto vantaggiosa per i prezzi di New York. Alle stesse cifre ci tornerei sicuramente!

title: Hidden costs for nothing in return… Shocking!
text: Currently staying here for 5 days. Checked in yesterday 11/05/22. Was charged an additional resort fee of $30 + tax and city tax over and above the cost of the room. I don’t normally mind a resort fee and it’s expected as you are paying for amenities which are useful. In this case we were told it covers free bottles of water when we want, this is not the case, it is upon check in only which we were not given, free teas and coffee when we want, again only at check in apparently which was not mentioned. Use of a gym which we were not told about or knew existed and wifi which is accessible to anyone near the hotel free of charge. Talk about feeling scammed. We have already tried to speak to people at reception and they seem disinterested and their stories of what the fees cover never match up. Does anyone actually know or is this just a bogus charge for foreigners? We seemed to be the only ones who were charged this fee upon check in at that time and waited in a substantial queue.

title: Very friendly staff and comfortable rooms.
text: The hotel's location was excellent, walkable to most of the sightseeing sites and shopping. We were able to check in early and were greeted by friendly staff, Kevin and Vito. They suggested restaraunts and things to do. The hotel room was clean and comfortable, but our favorite part was the bar—awesome bartenders with great drink selections. I would stay here again!

title: Super séjour, et un GRAND merci a Mr CHAFIK HALIMI !
text: Meilleure rapport qualité prix de NYC, avec un accueil chaleureux  de tout le staff et plus particulièrement Mr Chafik Halimi the best !!!! Il parle français courament et il est d’une grande aide pour les touriste français afin de passé un séjour dans les meilleures conditions

title: Molto ospitale
text: Stanza comoda, letto grande matrimoniale, 3 finestre, bagno spazioso e con tutti i servizi ( non presente il bidet). Colazione al bar dell’hotel,  Ottimo hotel. Vista spettacolare ogni mattina appena sbucati in strada, sulla 42st, a dx il sole che sorge, a sx il Summit  e time square.

title: Good location, nice chic renovation
text: Hotel is located in Tudor City, very close to UN and Grand Central Station. There has been major renovation made to rooms and lobby. Rooms are spacious for NY standards. Bathroom was clean, housekeeping was excellent. What I really didnt like was “resort fee” almost 150 usd which I was not aware of while booking a room. Also 100 usd deposit which was on hold for a month was bit strange. But overall hotel is nice, our room was nice. Thankfully we got room on 14th floor so there was no noise from street. If there was no resort fee I would come back.

title: Very bad service
text:
- the 'market' for breakfast: No fresh products, only on plastic, very little choice and very expensive
- the voucher system for breakfast: voucher of 15 dollars but if you buy a product at 5 dollars they  do not refund the difference, it is lost. The coffee machine did not work for 3 days, so no coffee we could not use our vouchers
- the service of the evening bartender (Sam): extremely unpleasant, rude, we arrived one evening at 23:01, he closed in front of us the fridges saying it is closed at 23h and refused to serve a drink. he has been rude the full week.
- the room for 3 people: no linen or or welcome products for 3
- very noisy room: a very loud noise in the hallway, after 3 calls someone finally came to try to fix but we had to change rooms at midnight because impossible to sleep.
No kindness at all in the staff.

title: awful breakfast & silly manager
text:
Even if the location of this hotel is correct, the 15$ coupon per person for daily breakfast, even not groupable with the one of your room partner (thanks to the the bar tender, kind as a prison door, confirmed by the manager on duty !!!), allows only one hot drink, one small bottle of juice & a small package of cakes ... absolutely not at the expected level of a 4 stars hotel !
The lack of flexibility of the manager on duty was regrettable.
Better to consider an alternative housing solution for a pleasant discovery of the Big Apple.

title: 5 stars
text: We are not usually the type to leave a review but in this case it is needed. We stayed at the Westgate for a girls trip to NYC and we were highly satisfied with our stay. Housekeeper Lydia was the highlight of our stay, Lydia was very polite and went above and beyond  to make sure we were taken care of. People like Lydia should be recognized for their hard work and positive attitude. Because of her, we will certainly be back!

title: Vote for Jose The Doorman!
text:
Our stay at the Westgate was great, but Jose the doorman, made it exceptional. He was always there available to help from coming to our aid, like when our bags broke in the street and watching out for our safety during our stay.

Humbly, 
Jessica & Kat

title: Angenehmer Aufenthalt
text:
Wir haben eine Road-Tour durch die USA gemacht und haben auch das Westgate besucht. Wir haben uns hier sehr wohl gefühlt. Besonderen Dank an Chafik, der sich sehr lieb um uns gekümmert hat.
Gerne wieder.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nice hotel  well located and clean 
A big thank you to Chafik who was there to help us throughout the stay 
Chafik is very patient and very professional, he always has a smile and that feels good 
It is very good advice

title: Hôtel très bien placé
text:
Hôtel très bien placé et très propre et beau
Un grand merci à Chafik qui nous a accueilli et qui nous a aidé tout le long du séjour
Il a tout le temps le sourire et ça fait du bien, il est patient et très pro
Heureusement qu il était là car nos bagages ont été mélangés à d autres et laissés au milieu de l hôtel
Il les a pris et les a mis de côté en attendant

title: Sauberes und Ordentlich Hotel
text:
Das Hotel ist sauber und gut ausgestattet. Das Zimmer hatte eine gut Größe, leider keine schöne Aussicht. 
Zu Fuß ist man in wenigen Minuten ander 5th Avenue und an der Grand Central Station. Trotz dieser Nähe ist es nicht zu laut. Vor dem Hotel befindet sich eine Bushaltestelle und in wenigen Minuten erreicht man eine Subway Station.

title: Great Hotel and Location
text:
Stayed 5 nights. Hotel was in a great location in Midtown close enough to access all sites easily but far enough out from the much busier Times Sq area. Only a short walk to Grand Central station making getting around by Subway easy.

Rooms were good sized, well presented and with good facilities - all that was needed for a city centre visit.

Staff were very helpful and special mention to hotel porters Chafik and Jose who were extremely helpful when our pre booked taxi (not booked via hotel...) to return to the airport didn't turn up. They contacted the car company for us immediately and made sure that the pick up arrived - thank you.

All round great trip and hotel and would stay again.

title: Formidable
text: Magnifique hôtel très classe, propre à la hauteur de ses étoiles. Accueil et gentillesse de Chafik qui parle parfaitement français et qui nous a conseillé et aider dans tous les détails de notre séjour. Au TOP. Nous avons été ravis à bientôt

title: Parfait
text: Hôtel extrêmement bien placé, très propre. Parfait pour un couple qui souhaite découvrir New York. Métro à cinq minutes à pied. Et une remarque particulière pour Chafik, qui a su être à l’écoute, de bons conseils souriant très professionnel et très gentil. Si nous devons revenir à New York c’est cet hôtel que nous choisirons.

title: Very Nice little Gem in Manhattan
text: We arrived at this hotel in our car to be greeted by a doorman who immediately told us it would be $75.00 to valet park our car.  I was dismayed because the website states, the parking would be included.  This was one of the reasons I chose Westgate Grand Central.  I had a car full of my family and my 83 year old father with me.  I was told I had to speak with the Manager, I went in and spoke with Kevin.  He was very helpful and had this charge removed. Keven was very reassuring and apologized for the confusion. He hen helped to assist us to our rooms and our luggage was brought up right away as well.  Our stay was very pleasant.  The Hotel is beyond beautiful and very clean.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The staff was very friendly. I love the Tudor City neighborhood and I felt like a local New Yorker.  The doormen were very helpful as well asking us if we needed assistance. I thought the marketplace was  good option for late night snacks.  I can't wait to visit New York again, My family feels the same and there is no other hotel for us but this one. Thank you Kevin and Westgate Grand Central for a lovely visit.

title: Superbe Hôtel et accueil
text:
Très bel hôtel idéalement situé dans New York. 
Un super accueil de tout le personnel mais particulièrement de Chafik d’une extrême gentillesse, très serviable, nous a donné beaucoup de bons conseils. 
Marie et son père Yves de La Rochelle :)

title: Perfect location great size room
text: After months of looking and panic at the constant reference to how small NYC hotel rooms are we decided to book the Westgate, it’s clean modern formally the “Tudor”. It has had a nice facelift, things you need to know “free wifi” this can cost you in NYC so good to be free also 24hr prior free cancel so with pandemic it’s good to have this option. The hotel Is about 500m from Grand Central so perfect for access across tele city, $5.50 gets you out and back to most areas with minimal issues. It’s a 20-25 minute walk to Time Square, Broadway, the Chrysler building is about 400m away 20 Mins to Rockafella so near most places,. The room 1616 was spacious big floor space closet (wardrobe) and average bathroom, hot water took a few minutes to build up and maintenance sorted it within 5 mins of asking.  We’ll worth a stay and we’d use this place again if we came back to NYC.

title: Très agréable et idéalement situé
text: Situé sur une partie calme de la 42ème rue, ce qui n'est pas négligeable pour une ville comme NEW-YORK, et  à quelques pas de Grand Central et de ses transports en communs,  cet hôtel est idéalement situé  pour se rendre dans les divers points de la ville. Avec mon épouse nous y avons séjourné une semaine. Nous occupions une chambre se trouvant au 14ème étage. Elle était spacieuse, bien équipée et très propre. Nous avons apprécié la literie qui est de très bonne qualité. Le personnel est très agréable  sympathique et à l'écoute de la clientèle. La qualité de cet hôtel a contribué à la totale réussite de notre séjour.

title: Super Hôtel et personnel au top
text:
Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet établissement. Le personnel vraiment de qualité. L'hôtel idealement situé. Chambre propre et ménage de qualité.

Petite pensée pour Chafik qui a été très acceuillant souriant et seviable et qui parle français.  Sans oublier José, Lisa et Sam également.

Je recommande fortement.

L & D

title: Accommodation
text: First time in NewYork. I wanted to surprise my girlfriend and propose to her. Chafik was so helpful. I’m thankful for his help. He deserves a raise. And a promotion. I don’t know how I would’ve done it without him.

title: Je recommande cet hôtel
text:
Hôtel très beau et proche de Times square (1 station) et de la gare grand central. Le personnel est très sympathique et le petit dejeuner est correct. Les chambres sont spacieuses et très propres (le menage est réalisé tous les jours).
Petite dédicace à Chafik (qui parle français) qui est un employé extra et de bons conseils. Il nous a réservé un taxi pour notre retour à l’aéroport, merci encore pour votre gentillesse 😃
Je recommande vivement cet établissement

title: Stunning!!!
text: Me and my partner stayed in Westgate for 9 days and we had the most beautiful stay. The staff are sooo accommodating even when we wanted to order a takeaway they did it for us, the room was stunning and so much bigger than we expected and so clean, the bed was the comfiest bed I've ever slept in I was sad to say goodbye to it! The hotel is located in a quiet area but with great transport links which is fab. We would definitely recommend and look forward to returning to Westgate.

title: Very good hotel !
text: We had a very warm welcome with a very attentive staff. As soon as we arrived, we were treated like princesses. Our stay went very well thanks to the advice of Chafik who speaks very good French and who knew how to advise us on the places to visit, where to eat and how to move in this huge city.

title: Nice place
text:
Very nice hotel just steps from the UN. Room was nicely sized for NYC, comfortable, clean,  and well appointed. Had an early morning meeting and the staff was terrific about storing my bags and making sure I was headed in the right direction. 

Had to leave for Penn Station earlier than originally planned and the staff was equally quick at retrieving my bag and making sure I had a cab to the station.

Will definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect place for an extended stay
text: I had the room with a balcony, beautiful set-up, hotel is so well located, close to metros, great restaurants within easy walking distance and yet quiet enough to sleep soundly without disturbance. Room was kept clean and well serviced every day throughout the stay. Impeccable service from every member of staff, professional, courteous, welcoming. Kevin and Nestor deserve a special mention here! Highly recommend - I will stay here again!

title: Muito opção de hospedagem em NYC, considerando localização e custo/benefício
text: Eu e minha filha Helena Trojahn Carrion estivemos hospedadas neste hotel de 11 a 28 de fevereiro de 2022. A localização é ótima. Fica a 1 quadra e meia da sede da ONU, a 2 quadras e meia da Gran Central Station e do Summit. Também se pode ir caminhando até a Times Square, com a vantagem de não ter o movimento e o barulho praticamente incessante daquela região da cidade. O hotel foi reformado recentemente e é bem bonito, agradável aos olhos. O quarto tem um bom tamanho, ainda mais para NYC. A limpeza é boa, limpam bem as partes que se vê, mas pecam onde não se vê, como embaixo e atrás dos móveis (cama, mesa e mesas de luz)  A equipe de funcionários é simpática e prestativa, exceto os dois funcionários do café/bar, um senhor e uma senhora, especialmente ela, cujo nome não me lembro, que é extremamente impaciente com os hóspedes que não dominam o inglês e normalmente fala alto, quase gritando. Sugiro que não tomem o café no hotel por isso, pelo mal atendimento, apesar de ser uma franquia Starbucks. Tem vários cafés ótimos nas próximidades do hotel, incluindo uma floricultura que serve café com lavanda e café com rosas, deliciosos! Por outro lado, faço questão de ressaltar excelente, impecável atendimento de José Doorman, um profissional exemplar: atencioso, culto, educado, eficiente, empático, paciente com os hóspedes que, como eu, não domino o inglês - mas sim espanhol e português -, proativo, simpático e solícito. A internet às vezes oscilava, pode melhorar. O preço é bom, só nos chateou o fato de minha filha ter que ficar mais uma noite e não manterem o preço das outras noites para ela, pelo contrário, cobraram bem mais caro essa última diária, Acho que deveriam ter levado em consideração as outras 16 noites que pagamos adiantado, inclusive...

title: Location, location, location plus a little more
text:
This is a only recently opened resort in the centre of NYC 42 nd street less than 10 min walk from Grand Central 20 from 5th avenue 
Recently taken over from Hilton I believe and a $$$ Restauration last year
Not quite finished because of the pandemic and as it is so new…. 
(Restaurant/breakfast room still closed)

This is a 4 star resort but they try hard and achieve to give it an upmarket vibe to attract tourists not only budget conscious business people

Kevin at reception was extremely helpful when we got stranded and needed our room for longer (thank you Cunard Line)- he and his boss Victor kindly upgraded our room free of charge as we stayed longer than planned and arranged for a late checkout for a modest fee. They give you breakfast vouchers

They check Covid vaccination, ID and all wear masks- however no alcohol gel in rooms or lifts 

The refurbished rooms work well with nice wooden flooring, high quality beds with Bockspring mattresses, good quality linen and towels, fluffy robes and slippers.
Toiletries are provided and of acceptable quality - there is a fridge in each room which you can stock yourself and you get a breakfast voucher which you can use at the bar in the house to buy food and drink. 
For New York the rooms are spacious but for my taste a bit dark- not upgrading the lighting to LED was a missed opportunity imo for economical and environmental reasons as much as for not having the option to make the rooms brighter

All in all happy to recommended or go back if I was in the area the location is perfect and the hotel offers reasonable comfort if you get a deal

title: TERRIFYING AND MALFUNCTIONING
text: I cannot express how traumatic this experience was. My fiance and I left after just one awful night despite that we were booked for several days. Everything from checking in to the room itself was a disaster. We had several malfunctions in the rooms despite that the rooms were renovated. The hotel itself was in awful shape. The staff did not even know what was inside the rooms/how to fix the many technical malfunctions of the lights/doors etc. We called them several times because the malfunctions of the lights were too drastic for anyone to sleep. The windows were facing the street and not blocked by any other buildings, yet somehow from the inside of the room it looked like it was raining even though it was bright, warm, and sunny on the outside. My fiance is not religious, and even he could tell the energy of the hotel was malignant and not welcoming, on both an aesthetic level and spiritual level. We had a terrifying experience that kept us up all night and woke us up twice where a motion sensor in the room was going off in the middle of the night despite nothing moving, not once, but twice in a row with a bright flashing light and a bell chime. We got so scared I literally began praying to God, because with every other horrific aspect of this hotel, this was just the icing on the ghostly cake. We quite literally left ASAP after we managed to book another hotel in the city. I cannot possibly imagine ever setting foot in such a bizarre, dark, ghostly space ever again. I hope to never even go near it, and I genuinely hope this review helps others who are more in tune with energies avoid this spot.

title: Badly Disappointing
text:
This review is a first for me because until now I've never stayed anywhere that disappointed me so much as the Westgate Grand Central. This is a pity, because it has a great location and spacious rooms, but it fails on one of the most important factors travelers depend upon with lodgings: Respecting promises.
This was my chief complaint with the Westgate Grand Central. The incident in question was the matter of a minor amount of money, but the way the Westgate handled it was the reason to feel disappointed in the property.
Like many (but not all) NYC hotels, the Westgate tacks on a "Resort Fee." Before my stay I received an email confirming my reservation and describing the amenities covered by the $30 fee. Among these was a $20 Food & Beverage credit. I still have the email in question but did not bring it with me as I was relying on the hotel to be aware of what was promised.
I think you can guess what happened: When I inquired about the food/beverage credit upon check-in I was told it didn't exist. So much for that promised-in-writing benefit.
In addition to this, although our room was large and the bed comfortable, there were a number of failings:
The room safe was broken. (We reported this.)
The door of one bedside table would not close. It had to be propped open or the guest sleeping on that side of the bed ran the risk of smacking their legs into it. (Also reported.)
The bathroom amenities were stingy: One small shampoo, one body lotion, NO conditioner.
The towels were thin and very rough.
Other NYC hotels charging comparable prices manage to provide complimentary bottled water. Not the Westgate, but at least they never promised that.
The Westgate Grand Central's website uses the terms "ELEGANT" and "LUXURIOUS." (I suppose offering guests a wee travel-sized bottle of hair conditioner, etc. isn't necessary for elegance and luxury.)
I wish they'd included, and lived up to, one more term: RELIABLE.
They saved $20. They lost us, and that's a shame because this hotel could have become one of our regular places to stay on our frequent visits to NYC.

title: Definitely coming back !!
text: The hotel was great !!! So clean and cozy; definitely a hidden gem in NY. Jose, the doorman was very welcoming and super nice. Next time I come to NY I will stay at the Westgate Grand Central for sure !!!

title: Good
text:
This hotel was completely overhauled this year and the rooms are all completely remodeled and brand new inside. I stayed here for a few days and here are some pros and cons. 

Pros: location is great, it's near Grand Central and in a non-touristy more quiet area of midtown east, the hotel has a beautiful lobby and the staff are friendly and hospitable, the room (while small but typical for midtown room sizes) had tons of storage space, a good bed, beautiful new wood floors, and a lovely bathroom. Also, the windows are all double paned so I barely heard any outside noise at all. It was also extremely clean and there is a kiosk in the lobby that sells food and Starbucks in the morning which is nice.

Cons: It's a very, very old beautiful hotel (I believe this used to be the Hotel Tudor) and every room has a doorbell which is quaint and cute however my room's bell had a malfunction and it would ring at random times at night and in the morning which was disconcerting (thought it was a weird other guest until it rang incessantly and I pulled the door open while it was ringing to see no one there, so either it's the weirdest ghost encounter I experienced or there was a technical malfunction, you decide). Additionally, the air conditioning while great had an issue with the compressor where it would cycle off and literally make a loud slamming noise. Between the slamming and the doorbell issue, it was comically bad for a few nights but this could have been an isolated room issue.

All in all, it's a lovely hotel and the overhaul is gorgeous and the location is great for people wanting to avoid the insanity of the Times Square hotel area.

text: The Westgate New York Grand Central very recently renovated their entire property and it's beauteous. We stayed for 3 nights this past weekend and enjoyed our stay in one of their impeccably kept corner king suites. Our suite had a large balcony with expansive views of Manhattan and the East River, one of the biggest bathrooms I've seen in all of NYC (all modern fixtures with backlit mirrors and a glorious quartz vanity), a separate sitting area featuring artwork by Klimt, luxury bedding, chic detailing, and more. It's only a few minutes from Grand Central Station and other NYC attractions, yet it's quiet and charming. Highly recommending!

text: This was very nearly our worst ever hotel experience. We lost most of the evening trying to get it sorted out and we ended up paying for a room and missing most of our evening in New York. In the morning it was sorted out and our payment refunded. It would have been much easier to allocate the room to us on arrival and sort the issue out in the morning, after all the hotel would have our card details swiped as part of the normal check-in proigress. It was a very disapponting experience that could have been handled much better. This was a pity as, otherwise, the hotel was very nice and well located.

title: Great stay
text: I booked a room here through last minute.com and I was pleasantly surprised with it! Staff very friendly and room (signature queen) was clearly newly refurbished, with dual aspect windows, amazingly comfy bed, flatscreen TV and a lovely large bathroom. Location was also great, under 5 min walk from grand central with a 24hr shop 1 block away, and about 20 min walk from Times Square. Check in and check out both very speedy - there was a $50 refundable damage deposit I wasnt aware of but this wasnt too much of an issue. Special mention to Kevin on check out, very accommodating and helpful. Breakfast was also great, although quite pricey ($35) for what was on offer. The only things that make this hotel lose a star was that the room I was in (1302) seemed to have absolutely no soundproofing from the room next door. I was woken up both nights at about 2am, as even though the people next door were talking in normal voices (not shouting), it felt like they were in the same room...! Also worth bearing in mind that at the moment (Feb 2020) they have building works on downstairs, on the 13th floor this didnt affect me much but nod may be more of an issue if on lower floors. Will definitely consider staying here again if I visit NYC again!

title: Great hotel and location
text: We loved our three night stay at Westgate whilst visiting New York. It was in a great location to see many of the main sites of New York. The rooms were newly refurbished and the bathroom was lovely. The bed was massive and extremely comfortable. All staff very friendly! Thanks for a lovely stay.

title: One of the best non-chain hotel experiences in NYC
text: I chose this hotel for two reasons: it was a preferred hotel on my corporate travel website, and it's across the street from the Concord Coach drop off and pick-up site for travel to/from Portland, Maine, and NYC. Bonus -- this is an historic hotel that has combined the best of historic ambiance with modern necessities. It is convenient to all of the NYC hot spots -- Times Square, Grand Central, and lots of restaurants -- and enough off the beaten track to be quiet for sleeping and for catching cabs, UBERs, busses, and a sense of perspective. My experience from check-in to check-out was a solid 5-star -- personal, attentive, and far above what I've experienced from the best of the major chains. Thank you to the front desk and the attentive waitstaff at the breakfast buffet. The Westgate goes to the top of my list for my next NYC trip even if I'm not taking the Maine-NY bus.

text: Buena localización, con un personal muy atento. Nuestra habitación, muy pequeña, oscura, incluso un poco claustrofobica, baño, aceptable. La limpieza muy bien, todo muy limpio. El desayuno es excesivamente caro 35$ por persona, y no es nada especial.

title: Very disappointed
text: Arrived at 3:50 and was told room was not ready and would not be ready for at least 45 minutes. Over an hour and a half later room still not ready. As a Westgate owner I am very disappointed. Spoke with assistant manager Seidy Velez who said there was nothing she could do.  Offered us older unrenovated room. Asked if we could check in to that room and switch after we went to theater. We were told that was not possible. Hotel is also under renovation and there was no notification of this given so no restaurant to even grab a bite to eat while we waited. Was given a bottle of wine as compensation after a nearly two hour wait.

title: Jose the Doorman ❤️
text:
We loved our stay in NYC but Jose the Doorman made our stay all that more memorable...so helpful getting us around town, sharing the insider tips and just a delight! Thanks again, Jose! P.S. This is 
Not a review of the Grand Central Westgate...we weren't too impressed with the place!

title: Perfect New York hotel
text: The staff was amazing (Specifically Seide and Kevin and the bellman whose name I didn't get). The room was clean and had everything we needed.  The location was convenient but just enough off the beaten path that it was actually quiet and restful.  There were plenty of food and drink options in the area and it was so close to transit that we could get everywhere we wanted to go easily.  But it was really the staff that made our stay exceptional.

title: Nice Hotel, great service
text: We had 4 nights in NYC, and enjoyed our stay at the Westgate. Eventough it currently is being refurbished, bar and restaurant areas on ground level, we had a lovely stay. All staff from cleaners to doorman to management were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Room we had was well populated and had everything we needed, somewhat dated features but that's what gives it the wonderful character. Good location 5-10 minutes from Grand Central station, and central for Manhattan. Gave this review a 4 only becaise of the refurbishment, but I'm sure that will be done to a high standard to make it a 5 * review.

title: First time visiting
text: First time staying here at the Westgate and we will definitely be back, everyone was so polite including Chris at the concierge, it felt like we were at home! Thanks for a pleasant stay and warm welcoming

title: Incredible Service & Perfect Room Size
text: When I go to NYC I always appreciate it when people try to be nice. This hotel is amazing at making you feel very special and taken cared of. The rooms are always very clean and is the perfect size for my needs. In particular, Kevin stops at nothing to make sure I look forward to my next business trip! Thank you so much for this!

title: Westgate NY Grand Central Hotel
text: Nice hotel in the heart of Manhattan, NY.  Close to shops and restaurants.  Currently under construction.  The doorman, Jose, was awesome and extremely helpful and caring. I would recommend as a place to stay.

title: Mr Siphiwe Hlatshwayo
text: I visited the US to celebrate my 40th birthday and in New York I stayed at the Westgate Hotel in Manhattan. The service was awesome! Kevin Law, the cleaner from Peru, Pablo at the restaurant and all the staff we interacted with were good hosts. What makes the place to be special is it’s location,  The place is situated at the creme’ of New York, it’s next to everything and it’s a home away from home. We’re definitely staying at the Westgate Hotel on our next visit to New York. Thank you.

title: Absolute Dilapidated Garbage
text:
I had a weeklong stay at this hotel for business. I arrived to discover the entire lobby is a complete disaster area because they are doing major construction. Literally 75% of the advertised gorgeous lobby is completely blocked off by huge construction walls. This also means there is a nonstop construction noise, which I could hear through the floor of my fourth floor room during the daytime.

In addition, the entire hotel and everything inside of it is run down and dilapidated. Truly it seems like every single object, piece of furniture, wall… Everything!… Is worn down. The quality of the furnishings and decor is on par with a Motel 6. See my attached photos for evidence… Wallpaper was peeling and ripped, paint jobs were scratched and chipping, the mirror had a giant crack in the corner, the toilet was peeling… We paid nearly $1200 for our stay and it felt like we were living in an abandoned building.

Also, skip the $32 breakfast buffet. It was disgusting and I should’ve just walked away as soon as I saw it Require that you walk through a dingy dirty hallway to get to it. The contents were more or less what you would get at a free continental breakfast at budget Motel. The eggs were runny, the sausage was cold, the juice is in cans in a bucket of ice, the pancakes are clearly prepackaged and not made fresh. It was revolting and a rip orf.

title: New York New York
text: I stayed here for Super Bowl weekend Jan 31st, 2020-Feb 04, 2020. The hotel was prefect, located in the heart of Tudor City. It was warm and cozy, clean and well staffed. The doormen Jose, Tony, Dennis and others where excellent. I highly recommend this establishment for lodging.

title: Great Experience!
text: My husband and I came out here to visit our son in college. The hospitality was amazing. Everyone was so friendly. Jose, the door man was very courteous and attentive. He made us feel at home and made our trip extra special. I highly recommend this property. The customer service was excellent!!

title: Super Cute and comfortable.
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night at the end of January. Quick and easy check in and the room was cozy and comfortable. Overall great stay, would definitely go back. The only thing is that the walls are pretty thin, so we could hear everything going on in the hallway.

title: Great stay!
text:
We visited in December from UK for our first time and if I had have read some of these reviews beforehand I’d have been really worried.. However, we had a great stay. 
All the staff we encountered were fab, room was lovely with a massive and comfy bed. Bathroom was very clean and huge- could have done with slight updating but was still fine. No view from window but wasn’t needed as we only went to the room to sleep or get changed. 

Had a problem with the shower late at night and rung reception and they sent someone up within minutes who showed us properly how to work it and he then went over the heating/AC with us in case we weren’t sure. 
Location was fab too, you can see the Chrysler building as soon as you step out of the hotel, Grand Central is about 5 minute walk and local supermarkets and lots of coffee houses. Times Square is about 15 minutes and Bryant Park about 10 minutes. Lots of subway stations around. 
We weren’t charged any sort of resort fees and the $100 deposit never even got taken out of our bank. 

Only slight problem could be the food/drink. We found out the cost of breakfast was $35 each and someone told us on our last day how they’d had it and regretted it as it wasn’t the best. We ended up buying 2 croissants from the cafe on ground floor one morning and they were $5 each and both were hard and a felt/tasted a few days old. So we resorted to breakfast in Grand Central everyday which was roughly $10-$12 for two pastries, a hot drink and bottle of water- much better and lovely atmosphere (highly recommend that). 
Free wifi worked the whole time we were there and didn’t have any problems with it. 
The AC in the room banged quite a bit during the night on two nights which was a bit annoying but not enough to have woken us up. 

Also when we were checking out and waiting for the shuttle to the airport the 3 places in the hotel to get food and drink were all closed from 12-4 so we sat in the lobby/bar area with nothing to eat and drink- would think that would be key time to open but we just walked 5 minutes up the road to Sandwicherie for lunch- lovely place for breakfast!

Whilst waiting for our shuttle, the concierge were very helpful to us as we were worried we would have to make our own way there as it hadn’t showed up. The concierge spoke to a taxi outside and held him for us if we needed him. Luckily our shuttle then turned up so it wasn’t needed, but was really helpful and he also recommended a different shuttle service for next time. 

Cannot wait to come back to New York (hopefully this December) and will definitely be staying back at Westgate and just hope we have the same experience we got last month!

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Uno degli hotel storici di New York, situato a midtown in una posizione da cui è facile raggiungere la metro (Grand station è davvero a due passi) ma anche a piedi è possibile raggiungere alcuni luoghi imperdibili della grande mela. l'Empire state Building ad esempio, a circa un chilometro, Times Square a un km e mezzo e il grattacielo Chrysler a qualche centinaio di metri.
Camere sufficientemente ampie, climatizzate, bollitore a disposizione, bagno pulito e accessoriato.
Davvero una soluzione alberghiera consigliata.

title: Comodissimo
text: È posizionato molto bene , vicinissimo alla stazione centrale , vicino time square , e a molte delle attrazioni da visitare a New York. Noi ci siamo trovati bene , non e lussuoso ma molto confortevole e vecchio stile ma nulla da lamentarmi . Ci ritornerei tranquillamente.

title: Great stay
text:
I had a very good stay here, though I am very low key when it comes to traveling. I really just used the room to watch TV and sleep. 

The room was clean, bed comfy, and check in was friendly and fast. I like that there is a restaurant directly across the street and you really can't beat the location.

Overall, it had a very low rate for my company and I would stay again.

title: Buen Hotel y bien situado
text: Nos alojamos durante 5 días en este hotel, la verdad es que muy bien ubicado, cerca de las principales atracciones turísticas de Nueva York. Y limpio y en buen estado, la atención de recepción también fue correcta. Una buena opción para descubrir Manhattan.

title: Ottimo!
text: Ero un po' dubbiosa all'inizio, ma questo hotel ha pienamente soddisfatto le mie aspettative! Situato in ottima posizione sulla 42esima strada: si raggiunge la Grand Central Station in pochissimi minuti, e percorrendo tutta la strada si arriva fino a Times Square. La lobby è accogliente e moderna, e il personale è stato sempre gentile e disponibile. La stanza è piccolina, ma a New York si sa, è difficile trovare standard room di ampie dimensioni. Inoltre, all'interno c'è tutto il necessario per trascorrere un ottimo soggiorno: letto e cuscini comodi, bagno spazioso, asse e ferro da stiro, armadio e macchinetta per il caffè/the sempre rifornita. Consiglio questo hotel sopratutto per il rapporto qualità prezzo! Io ho soggiornato durante il periodo di Capodanno 2019-2020 e il prezzo era fra i più bassi a Manhattan.

title: Great stay for birthday celebration in nyc
text: We traveled as two couples celebrating a joint birthday from Ireland. Had a lovely welcome from jose on arrival,check in was smooth and quick. Hotel is in a great location, 5mins walk to grand central,20mins walk to Times Square or 5mins in a taxi, costing 6 dollars. Better walking as you go by Bryant park great in December for ice skating and little stalls. Hotel was exactly what we were looking, we had a great nights sleep, walls a little thin could hear people next door. But over all room was warm,comfortable and very welcoming like all the staff. Will definitely will return to stay here. A very special thanks chapik he fixed us up with a great transfer to the airport at the 11th hour as I had booked transportation for the wrong date, we thank you again. Merry Christmas to all the staff.

title: Great visit
text: Had a good time at the west gate grand central. Nice rooms and great staff. Especially thanks to Chafik for giving me special attention and guidance on how to explore new york city the best way possible.

title: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location
text:
I stayed at this hotel from November 27th until December 1st and couldn't be happier with the experience.  Check in was swift and the staff were super friendly.  As the trip was to celebrate a milestone birthday,  a request for a room upgrade was granted and the room we got was superb and very comfortable. 

The hotel is ideally located on East 42nd Street. Grand Central Station is only a 5 minute walk away and there's a local starbucks and nearby CVS to meet all your needs.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough and will look forward to staying here again in the near future.

title: Birthday Trip Westgate NYC
text:
We enjoyed our stay right in the midst of NYC famous Manhattan. You could see the Empire State bldg., Chrysler, Trade Center, all from the front door. Perfect location for walking to Times Square. The Resort has 
NY’s Friendliest Doorman ‘Jose Moranez’
and the Sweetest Dining Cashier ‘Isa’ Bella
She made me happy to be there for breakfast each morning. Jose was always kind n dressed perfectly. We visited many sites n recommend the Tour of NBC Studios
Our 4 day trip was great right before Thanksgiving Day. Thank you Westgate.
Tom n Mary Lynn. Nashville, TN

title: Thanksgiving Stay
text:
Returned to Manhattan for a Thanksgiving break in one of our favourite city's to take advantage of the sales and checked into Westgate Grand Central Station.

Not being familiar with Westgate we only booked this property as at the time it didn't charge a resort fee so wasn't sure what to expect with the accommodation.

On arrival we were checked straight into the rooms and the check in process was very smooth and pleasant and found the staff to be very friendly.

Our room we were actually pleased with, not the biggest but just what we need for our city break but as always it always seems to be the bathrooms are very dated in NY.

Location is a little far out being on 2nd but we walk all over and do about 15 miles a day on foot so wasn't that much of a issue for us.

If the price was reasonable and also no resort fee we would stay again but unfortunately as i believe the resort fee just to be a bit of a con and just offer the hotel another revenue stream we wouldn't book this property again.

title: Hot water issue..
text:
Nice enough hotel, again like others had to pay a resort fee even though I booked with BA that stated on the booking terms all fees included.. room clean, some staff nice however we had no hot water for two days out of the four and the staff didn't know what to do. No apology, no one came up to fix it (even though promised) so just had freezing cold showers. No offer of just using another room to be able to have a warm shower. I also cut my toe open as there was a nail sticking up from the carpet. We had to put a towel down to make sure we didn't walk over it while going to the bathroom. Again they said someone would come up but no one did.
Shame there is a lack of care from staff and no one seems to try and resolve the  issue. Never mind we paid so there not bothered.

title: They charge $30 resort fee on top of room rate; a 2.5-3.0-star posing as a 4-star; no Internet
text:
The hotel has the basics:  clean sheets, hot water, and a door that locks.  However, the $30 'resort fee' borders on fraudulent (class-action lawsuits and draft federal legislation currently under way to end this bad practice) and a remote location unless you're in town for UN business.  

I booked through a 'hotwire' website which claimed this is a 4-star hotel, which it is not.  Thin walls/ no refrigerator/ the wireless never worked.  Although a Starbucks in the lobby which is nice.  Kind staff.  It's unfortunate the hotel is 'resorting' to race-to-the-bottom tactics to stay afloat.

title: Wonderful hotel!!
text: We stayed here in November & honestly couldn’t speak high enough of this lovely hotel. Staff were very attentive & friendly & always had smiles on their faces. We visited for my mums birthday & we received balloons & chocolate’s & an upgraded room which was so lovely & made our trip. Thank you so much, we would definitely recommend this hotel & will 100% be coming back. Thanks again!!

title: hervorragende Lage, gutes Hotel
text: Unser Eckzimmer mit zwei Queen-Betten war ausreichend groß; sauber, gemütliche Betten. Wir hatten es von daheim aus gebucht und waren zufrieden. Freundliches Personal und bis auf einem Tag (vergessener, aber nachgeholter Roomservice)  keinerlei Beanstandungen. Frühstück ist zu teuer, kann aber in fußläufiger Entfernung gefunden werden. Ein großes Plus ist die Lage - eben Midtown. Wir würden dieses Hotel wieder buchen.

title: Amazing
text:
We stayed at the Westgate for four nights  and weren't disappointed.  We were there to celebrate our 25th anniversary and not only did they put some chocolates and balloons in our room, they also upgraded is to a suite.

The staff were all so helpful and when our heating wasnt working they said they would send someone up in 10 minutes and they were true to their word.

Is ideally located away from the hustle and bustle which is nice as it can be very noisy and busy further up the 42nd street.

Would definitely recommend and thank you Westgate for making our stay so enjoyable

title: Lovely place to stay.
text: We stayed there for a week and can would definitely stay there again. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were clean. If I had to criticise one thing a mini fridge would have been perfect. The location was about 15 min away from the hustle and bustle of New York Times Square which we were glad of. Very helpful staff too

title: Ideal base while in NYC
text: We booked 3 rooms which were all well appointed if a touch on the small side which wasn’t a surprise in a place where space is at such a premium. One of the rooms had a spacious terrace with great views so would recommend spending a bit more on a better room if you’ll be spending any time in the room. Other than that we couldn’t fault the hotel. In particular the staff were very friendly and helpful from check-in to housekeeping and the left luggage guys. A particular mention to Chafik who went above and beyond in arranging transport. The location was good  with subways within a short walk and not far from the centre of mid-town. Would stay here again.

title: Lovely Hotel.
text: Stayed here from the 8th November to the 11th. All I can say is the rooms were very clean, the bed was very comfortable. All members of staff were polite and friendly. Would definitely stay here again 👍

title: Try somewhere else
text:
The staff are lovely, especially those at breakfast. Bilal and Vito stand out.
The bed was comfortable but the room was tired. I wondered if it had been refurbished. If it had then I dread to think what it was like previously. That is unless it is refurbished to look tired.
We had an adjoining door and I could hear everything that was said. The noise from the hairdryer was as if they were standing next to me. Thank God that they were not amorous.
I felt that we paid more than we should for three nights and that breakfast was expensive.
It is a short walk to Central Station but for the price I would expect to be closer to Time Square.
My advice is to find somewhere else.

title: So, so
text: The hotel itself doesn’t anyhow stand out in Manhattan. It’s in really good location (obviously depending what are you after in NYC). As there’s isn’t too much to complain about, except of no wi-fi included (unless it has changed since May) in the price of the room and the fact the the room we stayed in, especially the bathroom was very, very fatigued; there’s also not so much to praise the place for. Perhaps giving three star review would be a little bit too harsh I’ll give bit far fetched 4/5.

title: Solides Hotel
text:
War vom 8.Oktober 2019 bis 13. Oktober 2019 in diesem Hotel.
Das Hotelzimmer:
War zwar kein Großes Hotelzimmer aber wenn New york besichtigt ist es ok ist man immer unterwegs. Ordenlich eingerichtet mit Tv Einem Schreibtisch Im Bad war sogar eine Badewanne was ich nicht als Selbstverständlich hielt.
Der Service:
War einmal an der Bar wurde Freundlich bedient.
Der Empfang war auch immer Freundlich auch zuvorkommend beispielsweise wenn es geregenet hat wurde man beim verlassen gefragt ob man ein Schirm vom Hotel haben will. Oder andere fragen hat.
Die Lage.
Das Hotel liegt in Manhatten ein Block von Grand Central was denn vorteil das man immer in der Mitte von New york ist und mit der bahn von grand Cdntral Station zügig wohin kommt.
Fazit .
Wenn ein kurztrip nach new york macht ohne schnick schnack is das hotel gut

title: An enjoyable stay.
text:
We had booked 3 nights here, one queen bed room and one twin, but we found on arrival we'd been given 2 queen bed rooms, we explained we needed a twin and the receptionist just shrugged her shoulders, tapped away on the keyboard and said, "no problem, one twin, one queen". Sorted!! Yes the rooms were dated, small and one looked out onto a back wall, but it's NYC, but the rooms were clean, beds comfortable and staff friendly and polite.
We didn't use the restaurant, we had breakfast up the street at John's Diner, which is excellent.
The doormen were always helpful, including lending us umbrellas on a really wet day and in hailing taxis.
The Westgate is well located and functional, if you want big and modern go to Orlando.
Would we stay here again? Yep, happily.

title: Would not stay here again
text: Stayed here as a party of 6 from 2nd to 6th nov. Check in all was fine until we discovered there was only one bed in each of our 2 rooms that was meant to sleep 3 in each. So when we highlighted it we were told that there wasnt any more rooms available as it was marathon weekend and that because we had booked a lower rate room we were given what was available at check in. We had booked through a reputable travel agent in january so obviously rooms would be cheaper then.they couldnt do anything for us. We were frustrated as one could imagine travelling 13 hours to get to this hotel and to be told this. The manager on duty was so rude to us about it. Alexendra was her name spoke so agressive and abrupt to us that we couldnt even explain our booking to her. She wanted us to ring our travel agent there and then to get it sorted and as you can imagine with the time difference this was impossible. I showed her the email from our booking and then she tried to help us. It had said on our booking 2 beds in each room. But still she wasnt accepting that it was an error on their side and kept blaming our travel agent.there were people waiting for rooms and alexandra went and told them there wasnt rooms because of us because the people were giving us dirty looks.when she returned to reception she spoke in a foreign language to her staff this made us feel very uncomfortable as we felt she was talking about us. We were in reception for a full hour and a half we were offered a glass of water by the concierge for our inconvienience. We had people stop and look at us talking with the manager on duty over how we were being spoken too and when i told her of how embarrassed by this she told me "its new york people look all the time". How unprofessional. As a manager myself i couldnt believe this response. We got an extra room eventually and were told they went way above and beyond to accommodate  us. Rooms were dark and small not designed for 2 people. Might aswell had no windows as they were facing a grey wall. We got over this as we were going to be out as much as we could. One of the rooms had no sockets working. Their coffee machine wasnt working. They asked for someone to come and look at it and by the time of check out it still wadnt working. Wifi wad based on your name and room number. My room wifi wasnt working and i asked at reception. I got shouted at by a male that it does work. They had spelt my surname different to me so therefore mine wouldnt work. And yet again told me that i spelt my name wrong that thats how they spell it in america. Baffled by that statement as i thought a surname is a surname spelt the way its meant to be. 100 dollars was taking from 2 of our accounts for the room security which is fine but one had 200 dollars taken when we asked  the reason why we were told we had an   outstanding balance as we had to get another room. I spoke with the manager on the day and after a discussion this was scrapped.i felt she was just smirking at me just to please me she listened. Locks were broken on the door of one our rooms.There was cracks in the sink of  our room. There was no safe in the room. I heard one of the male receptionists treat customers badly every day shouting at them. Its not a right way to carry on. While we were there we met more people that had issues with this hotel so it wasnt just us. I witnessed a lady shout at the manager over a problem they had. I have informed my travel agent about our stay and told them to avoid this hotel going forward as they will have more complaints. They need to get their system right so that people like us will not have to face the ordeal and embarrassment like we did and get no satisfaction. Also they need to change some of their ftont desk team as they dont have a manner to deal with people and slso maybe get new polite management that dont treat people rudely.

title: Excellent Value
text: We stayed at the Westgate for 6 nights while attending a wedding and sightseeing in Manhattan. The room was clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and the shower had a good rain shower head. We found all staff to be extremely efficient and very friendly. We especially enjoyed daily visits with the doormen.The location was perfect for easy access to the subway or taxis. The complimentary daily breakfast that was included with our wedding package was excellent with a wide variety of foods.

title: Room was ok, location great. Customer service horrific!
text:
Firstly, I am beyond disgruntled with the customer service. 

1. When checking in, we were deducted a deposit (as expected) however, the concierge didn’t inform me how much it was and deducted the $100. Disgruntled moment one.
 2. On check out, there were no charges. The concierge said my $100 (£78) would be refunded in 3-4 business days. Fine. 7 days later, no refund. Disgruntled moment two. 
3. I try to email- no email is available on the website. I call. The after explaining the problem, the concierge asked me if I had a question or if I was just going to make statements! Disgruntled moment three. She told me I was rude and passed me over to an answer machine. I left a message, no return call. Disgruntled moment four.
4. I have now called three times and nearly two weeks after I have checked out, I am still £78 out of pocket, plus my phone bill, as I am calling from the UK. I have to wait 30 days before my bank will refund me the money. 

Overall, beyond disgruntled with the customer service. I wouldn’t stay here for that reason alone. Simply disgusting! I know I won’t even get a reply from writing this review either! So avoid!

title: Convenient place to stay
text: Although the decor seemed dated, at the time of my visit work had already begun to resolve this. My room was spacious but dark. The 2 windows looked out onto the walls of the adjacent buildings. I couldn't fault the staff at all. Everyone I dealt with was friendly, professional and helpful. Mike, the Conceiage, certainly went the extra mile. He helped me when I was having problems checking-in online for my flight home and every morning I would tell him my plan for the day and he would advise me on how to maximise my time and what transport to use. The bar was cosy. Most of the main attractions in Mid-Town are within walking distance. With Grand Central Station 10mins walk away, uptown and downtown are only a subway ride away as well. This place is ideal for a solo traveller.

title: Great stay very friendly
text:
Just returned from this great hotel seamless check in /out
Deposit for breakages $150 on credit card $200 cash
Rooms were so comfy and clean always left immaculate on our return after a long day out bedding and towels changed daily...4 lifts no concerns quick and easy..ovley atmosphere in the Hotel... Complimentary large brolleys judt sign one out then return... Left our luggage after check out then returned to rest and collect before heading back to airport bell hop guy organised our taxi at stated time we were informed that the rest of hotel is undergoing refurbishment and all pictured on display it and it looks good... Well worth the stay loved it we would return.. We booked this through BA... Brilliant thank you

title: hotel avec très bon emplacement
text: bon rapport qualité prix.bonne emplacement à proximité de grand central et donc métro et train. personnel disponible surtout CHALIK. un grand merci à lui. petit déjeuner avec prix élevé mais autres possibilités à proximité

title: Mid Term Break
text:
WOW
My first visit to NYC and the Westgate was the hotel chosen
This hotel did not let us town, great location, great friendly staff.
Superb spotless clean rooms.

Big shout out to Barman Nickalue and and doorman Jose who were so friendly and helpful to us

title: Bastante bueno
text: El hotel está realmente bien para el precio que he podido observar en esta ciudad. Bien situado, a 5 min de la estación grand central y a una calle de las naciones unidas. La habitación amplia, cama cómoda y WC correcto. Las almohadas podrían mejorar pero te dejan un par de ellas para cada uno. Tiene máquina de café y alguna nevera.

title: hotel with character
text:
The Westgate Hotel is listed for its historical significance and its central position made it easy to get to all the main NY sites and attractions. Our room was on the 14th floor and although the bathroom was very 'beige'- it was functional and we felt our room was very comfortable and in character with the building. 
The room was cleaned and the linen was replaced every day. Complimentary tea and coffee making facilities provided but the Americans lean towards the 'creamy' evaporated milk cartons.
The staff were friendly and helpful throughout and we were able to leave our baggage after checking out to make the most of our final day before leaving late afternoon. We also used the complimentary brolly service.
The hotel has a breakfast bar on the ground floor but we did not use it - preferring to eat out.

title: Great Service!
text: Enjoyed our stay at the Westgate.  Jose the doorman made our stay so much fun.  He was always there to help us with whatever we needed.  He was so witty and interacted with our family in a very pleasant way.  He made our stay a little more special with his great service!

title: Per visitare comodamente New York
text:
Hotel sulla centralissima 42st a due passi da Grand Central Station, ottima posizione per girare in lungo e largo la metropoli servendosi sia della metro che dei pullman.
La struttura è datata e ristrutturata da qualche tempo. La lobby è accogliente e moderna. La stanza assegnata silenziosa, e pulita ma arredata con mobilio datato. Il bagno tenuto bene però disponeva solo di una vasca da bagno con doccia fissa un po’ troppo bassa. Infatti per rimare sotto la doccia bisognava piegare le ginocchia.
La stanza inoltre non dispone di frigobar, anche se si tratta di un hotel 4 stelle.
Personale estremamente cortese e disponibile.
Cambio giornaliero degli asciugamani, anche se a volte hanno dimenticato di lasciare il set completo.
Complessivamente buon rapporto qualità prezzo per gli standard dei locali del centro di New York.

title: Destacar la atención del Camarero Pablo
text: Hemos estado 9 días en el hotel y todo ha estado muy bien. Hotel confortable y céntrico. Destacar la atención por parte del camarero de restaurante Pablo, nos hizo sentir como en casa con su trato y amabilidad en todo momento, más personas así necesita la hostelería. Tambien mencionar al botones Jose que nos ayudó con un problema de los traslados a la salida. En general lo recomendaría.

title: Hotel stay October 2019
text: Absolutely amazing hotel, stayed for four nights, 5 friends. The hotel is about a 15/20 min walk to Times square. The rooms were very clean and the housekeeping was very attentive, the rooms were cleaned everyday and the maids laid our pyjamas on the bed and washed out private coffee mugs that we were using. Everyone was very helpful form the checking in staff to the starbucks coffee guy. The best part was definitely the door staff every time we left and returned they opened the door with a lovely smile, organised taxis and always checking we were Ok and if there was anything they could help us with. Would highly recommend this hotel for its location price and excellent service.

title: An ok 3 star, not a 4 star hotel
text: So the hotel is ok but is probably overrated by at least 1 star. It is in a very old building and the rooms are in need of a major overhaul, especially the bathrooms where most of the caulking is either missing or infested with mold and mildew that makes the entire room smell musty. The cleaning was ok but I was given a room that clearly was not vacuumed as there was hairs and the plastic parts of clothing tags visible on the dark blue carpet.  Other reviews I see mention cleaning as an issue here and I would agree the day to day cleaning is sub-par. The bed was decent and comfortable but very dated along with the other room furnishings. Bed skirt was falling off and just made everything look kind of sloppy and low quality for a 4 star rating. There is a $30 per day “resort” fee and this is supposed to include amenities and a $20 daily credit at the hotel shop/bar but the posted hours for that are not honored. Both nights it was closed by the time I got back to the hotel (10:25 and 10:40pm) even though I was told at check in and it says on all the signs it is open until 11:00pm. I asked the desk why it was closed already and the guest standing on line said “it’s closed 30 mins to an hour early every day I’ve been here, a full week!” He was at the desk complaining about the cleaning in his room also. The staff is really nice and tries to address issues but it is clear the owners are trying to get by as cheaply as possible and leaving the staff to deal with the complaints that come from that. Last I was told the resort fee was $30 daily but they actually charged a little over $32 per day, not a huge deal but why lie for 2 extra bucks?

title: Piacevole sorpresa
text: Buon hotel situato in zona centrale, a pochi minuti di passeggiata dalle principali attrazioni e dalla Metro. Camera accogliente, spaziosa e pulita; bagno un po' vecchio ma pulito e con buoni prodotti. Piacevole sorpresa la colazione inclusa nel prezzo e il wi-fi in camera. Lo consiglio per chi vuole vedere New York anche in pochissimi giorni.

title: A bit let down
