text: Just back from an amazing 5 nights in the Westgate Hotel New York City we arrived at the hotel and it was a very smooth check in the staff on the desk were very pleasant and they very kindly upgraded the couple we were with to an amazing room with balcony as it was there honeymoon all the staff were lovely door men always had an hello and a goodnight when leaving and returning to the hotel that was all perfect unfortunately to the bad bits the cleaning of the room was good the first two days as I would not expect the bed linen to be changed but after the 3rd day I asked at the front desk and they said they would tell cleaning staff but unfortunately the same linen was left on the beds for the whole 5 days the reason I know this as the first day I was there my husband dropped food on the bed sheets and it was still there 5 days later also toilet was not cleaned properly as I was a little ill on the second day and there was a little left on the back rim off the bowl and it was also left there for the remainder of our trip and with no toilet brush I could not clean it myself it was such a pity that the cleaning staff do not do there job to a high enough standard as it is a lovely hotel and location was perfect and staff lovely but the cleaning issue needs to be fixed

title: Wife’s 50th birthday trip.
text:
We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Westgate Hotel to celebrate my wife Suzy’s 50th birthday. 
After we checked in we went to our room where Suzy was greeted by some balloons, a birthday card and some truffles left my the hotel management.......what a thoughtful, beautiful gesture, and very much appreciated by myself and Suzy.
I had spoken to the Duty Manager Sadie a couple of days before flying out to explain the purpose of the trip and to enquire about a balcony room. Sadie explained that they were extremely busy and this would be unlikely. Imagine my surprise when we got in to our room to discover.........a balcony. Thank you Sadie for making this happen, it was brilliant.
All the staff we met, from the front desk to the doormen were great. They were extremely courteous, polite, and very helpful.
The Westgate is a great hotel, has friendly, knowledgeable staff and is in a good location from which to explore New York. 
I would have no hesitation in recommending the Westgate to everyone and I look forward to returning soon.
Thank you for making my wife’s birthday trip so special.

title: A great stay with wonderful staff
text:
Stayed here with my partner for 5 nights. 
The welcome was warm and friendly and the room had a great view of 42nd street. 

Ideally situated, with central locations close by. 

The staff went out of their way to be helpful and made our stay very enjoyable.

Clean and cosy room, very nice stay had by us both.

title: Fab Hotel, Lovely Staff, Great Location
text:
Upon arrival we paid a $200 deposit that i wasnt aware of. Although it does state it on their website, it did not state it on the third party website i used to book. i paid this by card 1st october, checked out 6th october then was refunded 16th october (It took so long because barclays put a hold on the payment)

I have never seen such good customer service before, to the point i saw one of the door men run to the end of the road just to try get 2 hotel guests a cab. All the staff were friendly.Everytime we got into the lift if there was a staff member in there they would say good morning and to have a good day etc. They also have free umberellas to use, you just have to sign them in and out. The wifi was free, the beds were made clean and fresh everyday as well as new towels, the computer and printer in reception was free and the facilitie helped alot as some attraction tickets i pre printed got lost. 

The only thing i can think of that i wasnt keen on was the foodshop inside. It was so expeinsive. There is a minimart 2 minutes walk that we used instead.

title: Funny and ridiculous
text: I checked in at 3:00 pm and went out for dinner. When I got back, I couldn't open my room with the same card. I checked with the receptionist and they said I never checked in within their "system" and for some reason, I can get the key by mistake. They already took out my luggage and assigned that room to others. I was asked to wait since there is no room that night. I waited until midnight and cancel the reservation. They didn't even do anything to make it up to me. This is really funny and ridiculous.

title: lovely Hotel
text: recently stayed at this lovely Hotel with my daughter we were very pleased with it not only was it very central to great locations it was very clean and the beds were very comfortable at the end of long days site seeing that is just what you needed. We both said how nice it was to have a decent sized Television instead of small ones you normally get. Staff was very helpful and courteous I would definatley reccommend this Hotel and would happily return keep up the good work Westgate

title: Decent smaller hotel in Midtown East
text:
Stayed for 2 nights in this nice hotel around Tudor City in Midtown East Manhattan. Good location to explore Midtown - Broadway shows, Grand Central, UN, Empire St Bldg, Times Sq, South Central Pk are all near by. There are more Central locations but this hotel was less expensive, and the walking is easy. 

Hotel breakfast was terrible - crusted pancakes, sour fruit, tasteless sausage - though the waitstaff was good, for a buffet. 

Parking was pricey ($75/d) since we drove up, but still much less than the train. 

Hotel is a historic site. It is only 3 rooms wide. Rooms look (and smell) newly redone. Nice view onto 42nd street and the original windows can open partly. The rooms are moderate size with a larger bathroom than you would expect.

title: Bellman Sophique is amazing
text: I stayed at the Westgate Hotel with my husband and two children for a week. It was central, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The service for breakfast was great also. The most outstanding person however was Sophique (sorry if the spelling is incorrect). He literally saved the day when we forgot our passports (I know I know) and was at the airport for our flights. He got them safely to us there with minutes to spare and kept us updated along the way. He was professional, friendly and very, very helpful. I would totally stay at the Westgate again purely because of him. He is amazing, knowledgeable and friendly. Thank you.

title: Great hotel
text: Very conveniently located in 42nd street. Great hotel with friendly staff and everything we needed. Breakfast choice good and room comfy and well stocked. Access to wifi confusing as room said pay but it was in fact free. Would recommend to anyone.

title: Au centre de Manhattan
text: Hôtel superbement bien placé avec vue sur Chrysler Building à chaque sortie 👍 emplacement qui nous a permis d'itinérer à pied dans Manhattan, de Central Park à Brooklyn. Très bon couchage et rien à redire sur la propreté. Petit déjeuner au top tout comme le personnel réellement charmant ! Nous le gardons dans nos tablettes pour un éventuel nouveau séjour à NY 😉

title: 3 days in an average hotel
text:
Friends came over on the Queen Mary and this hotel was included in their journey so we elected to stay here also.  It is an old historic building with lots of character.  The beds were comfortable, super quiet rooms and plenty of hot water.  

Supposedly the hotel started a renovation in Oct 2018 but no signs of it were seen anywhere.  Some of the staff were friendly and helpful (bellmen) while others were distant and unfriendly.

There is a bar/breakfast room/coffee shop in the lobby that has very, very limited hours.  Basically it is open for breakfast and evening drinks only.  All three days the lobby and attached sitting area were full of people waiting on their rooms to be prepared and shop was closed.  They could have bought drinks and coffees has the hotel thought to add one staff during the day to keep the shop open.  Bizarre.

Finally, we paid extra for a corner “suite” with a balcony.  The balcony view was nice and good for two people.  This was a treat compared to any big-box standard hotel up the street.

Overall, it was an ok stay at an ok hotel.  It could be spectacular hotel with some slight improvements especially in the attitude of the staff, provision of drinks/snacks during the day and some dressing up of the lobby areas.

title: Great hotel and great value
text:
We stayed three nights at the hotel for a long weekend in NYC.  The staff was great and the room was well maintained.   The hotel is close to Grand Central that you can walk there yet far enough away not to hear all the street noise.  

I would highly recommend this hotel for a great NYC trip.

title: Archer Hotel
text:
My first time here, and what a delight. Really nice hotel in a great location.Nice rooms and bar areas. Breakfast was really good too.
The staff are outstanding at all times, I have to mention Troy and Jonathan who really looked after me on a daily basis, top professionals and a real pleasure to talk to.

title: Reseña con especial para camarero desayuno hispano Pablo
text: Hemos estado hace unos días en este Hotel y he de decir que nos ha agradado mucho. Bien situado en Manhattan, cómodo y limpio. Se habla también español, como en todo Nueva York. El desayuno del hotel, incluido en el precio, nos pareció bastante bueno y amplio. Quiero felicitar en especial a uno de los camareros, PABLO, por su simpatía y agradabilidad natural. Pendiente siempre para ver a quién le faltaba o necesitaba otro café. Nos atendia en español, lo que nos ha hecho sentirnos familiarmente.

title: In my opinion the best hotel in manhattan!!
text:
We have returned home from our 7th stay at this hotel and have already booked for our next stay. This truly is a fantastic hotel and the staff could not be more accommodating. From the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out we could not have asked for anything more from the hotel. The rooms were also  spacious and clean. A massive shout out goes to Jose the bellman. Nothing  was ever too much trouble and he  went out of his way to go that extra mile to help. For example, we asked where we could get a red velvet cake from and he went all the way to Jersey to collect a cake for us and even came into work early to ensure that we have it before our departure. He really is an ambassador for the hotel and the Westgate brand. 
I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Manhattan as it is truly the best. Thanks for another fantastic stay and I am already counting down the days until my return.

title: First time stay in NYC
text:
The room 821 was clean, good size, and comfort. It is located close to popular areas and attractions in NYC. The price was mid range, but still ok for NYC hotel. The receptionist Kevin was friendly and helpful. Easy to grab 42nd st bus right out the front door. Walking distance to Grand Central, Library, Bryant Park, Times Square, etc. Recommended Hotel

Special thanks to Jose the doorman he is wonderful. Very friendly and welcoming.

title: Friendly and courteous staff
text: We have traveled to this area and for the second visit we chose this hotel. We were immediately  greeted by Jose the Doorman , a friendly and kind smile  like all the staff in this hotel .  We loved our stay and the location is away from hustle and bustle of the streets, In one year the changes have only impressed us,

title: vakantie
text: leuk hotel , geen supergrote kamers maar voldoende ruimte, alles netjes en goed service, uitgebreid ontbijtbuffet,vriendelijk personeel en goede roomservice,ook de dagelijkse netheid was uitstekend, je kon zelf kiezen op welk uur je kamer werd gepoetst, ideale ligging op de as naar times square en de Hudson rivier, vlak bij het gebouw van de verenigde naties

title: A Gem
text: Yes it is an older hotel, but it has been a wonderful stay. The location is great with so many NYC places of interest within walking distance. The staff has been super friendly from check in to breakfast team to housekeeping. The rooms are smaller than the modern new hotels but they are well appointed and very comfortable. Sadly no view from the windows but with so many tall buildings within the city it must be hard to get views.

title: Poorly maintained rooms, unhelpful front desk staff
text: I would not recommend a stay here unless you have no other option. I arrived at 10:30pm at night to be met with sleepy and surly front desk staff and then a dirty room- dusty and cobwebbed. I has a two night stay and could not leave fast enough.

title: NEVER coming here again
text:
Me and my partner arrived at the Westgate hotel an hour before checking in. As we walked in the entrance, yellow liquid was dripping from the ceiling and it went all over me. When I told the manager about the leak, she was very defensive and made me feel as if it was my fault for coming through the entrance in the first place. After a very unpleasant check in, she reluctantly agreed to give us $11 free WiFi for the inconvenience (which we already thought was included but ok.) 
When we got to the room, there was a very strong smell of urine, my partner suggested it might be from the vents and when we looked, the vents were absolutely coated with black mould. I have NEVER experienced this in a hotel before, we headed back down stairs and the manager was so rude and defensive about the mould it made me question who employed her in the first place. She said “you can get another room or you get out” in an extremely aggressive tone. She had an issue with me bringing up the yellow liquid/ mould and she very clearly didn’t want manage the hotel, she made us feel so uncomfortable that we really couldn’t stay there. We went up to the room to get our bags, find another hotel and leave. We were up there for about 15 minutes while trying to find another place (which was very difficult under late notice.) two security guards came up and I heard one of them in the hallway with my partner (he was outside on the phone trying to sort out the refund while I found a hotel.) one of the security guards was ordering us out of the hotel and whilst we were getting our bags and already cooperating, there was no need for him to try and take our bags or threaten to call the police when we were already trying our best to go. I had a panic attack in the room as this was happening, he could have been calm and asked us to leave but it was too much to threaten us and try and take the bags as we were going, on top of everything else that happened (The other man was ok with us though and did come to check that I was ok) I’m really upset with this chain and I wouldn’t recommend that anybody goes here. I can’t believe how we were treated, we were able to get a refund for the 4 days that we were supposed to be there and booked into somewhere else immediately. This whole experience reduced me to tears.

title: Nice hotel in NYC
text: The room was ok, good size, and comfort. It is located so close to popular areas and attractions  in NYC. The price was mid range, but still ok for NYC hotel. The receptionist was friendly and helpfull. Recommended

title: Old rooms with a bit moldy smell.
text:
The hotel is a bit faraway from the restaurants, shops etc. The hotel rooms need updating. The room and the corridore was a bit stuffy and the lift got stuck which was scary.

Starbuck coffee shop is nice in the lobby. The gym facilities are quite simple.

I would not choose this hotel ahain.

title: Trip to New York City
text: Firstly any of the staff we dealt with at this hotel were always friendly and helpful. It's a hotel with a lot of character and in a good location but considering it's in central Manhattan the location is actually fairly quiet. Turn left out of the hotel and you're heading towards Grand Central (approx. 10 mins walk) and Times Square (approx. 15 mins walk). Turn right and you're heading towards the United Nations (approx. 5 mins walk). Be sure to take the Roosevelt Island Tram (cable car) over to Roosevelt Island and visit the Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms Park. A good place for breakfast near the hotel is The Sandwichery. I pre-booked our taxi online from the hotel to JFK and the cost was approx. $90. The doorman at the hotel told me he could have got me one for $61 so keep that in mind. Also on our last day we were not leaving for the airport until 7pm. Hotel reception very kindly gave us access to the fitness rooms so that we could shower and change before going to the airport. Our room was comfortable and clean. It did not have a view but if you're visiting NY then you will be out all of the time as there is so much to see.

title: Molto soddisfatta
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per 10 giorni a inizio luglio e mi sono trovata benissimo.
Camera sempre pulita, piccolina ma con bagno, ben attrezzata e in centro a Manhattan, vicinissimo al Grand central terminal.
Staff molto gentile e disponibile che ha cercato di aiutarci in ogni nostra richiesta. 
Lo consiglio vivamente, al piano terra c'è anche una bella saletta con divanetti e tavoli a disposizione.

title: The smallest room I ever had
text:
PROS: Comfy bed, refreshening air conditioner and friendly staff.
CONS: they gave us the smallest room , 110 sq.ft. , even do there were few people staying at the hotel, 3 very small elevators, the view from the windows was a brick wall.

title: Fantastic place, super friendly
text: Great hotel and really reasonably priced. Nice clean rooms which were serviced every day. Good location within 5 minute walk of Grand Central station which had excellent connections across Manhattan. Didn’t try their breakfast as that was a little expensive but it looked nice. Coffee was great though. Very nice helpful staff.

title: Nice Hotel and Good Location
text:
If the rooms were a bit nicer, I would rate the Westgate "excellent".  But it's an older hotel and kind of configured weird.  See the picture of the bathroom I had this week.

Nevertheless, I've stayed there multiple times because it is close to my office, prices pretty well, and the staff are nice.

Rooms are quite small, but beds are comfortable enough.  They give you the toiletries and good towels.

This is not a high end hotel, but do have a bar and snack bar area on the lobby.  Staff are friendly and the place is clean.

title: Rooms a bit tired but location makes up for it
text: Reasonably priced hotel very close to Grand Central and UN. The rooms could do with some updating (but frankly that applies to 90% of hotels in NYC) but the good location makes up for it. A bit quieter than other locations more in the centre of mid-town area.

title: No Complaints
text: My husband, toddler and I stayed here for a weekend to visit family. The hotel itself is top notch in terms of quality of room and staff service. Every staff we encountered spoke to us and asked how they could help, including staff just passing in the hallway. It is very clean and the included breakfast was very good. We both grew up in NY and likewise are familiar with the standard room sizes and expectations of NYC. That being said, the price we paid was reasonable considering the location. Only 15 min walk to Time Square. Free WiFi is also now included, which may have been an upgrade compared to the past. Overall no complaints. Would definitely consider staying again when back in the area.

title: New York New York... Fab !!! 🙌
text: Stayed here with my daughter for a 5 day break in the big apple.  Great location, close to grand central station on 42nd street.  Hotel was clean and perfectly adequate for our needs. Shower hot, bed comfy.... and room was quiet. Air con not great but apart from that it was perfectly fine. Staff were very helpful. The only gripe I have is my card being charged with what I can only think is a damage deposit... $100. Which despite being told had been released back to my account ... 4 days later still hasn’t . I’m hoping this isn’t going to be an issue... we’ll see over the next few days.....

title: Disappointing
text: I wouldn’t recommend this hotel in New York, it is at  the wrong end of 42nd Street and there is nothing much nearby apart from a few random shops and a couple of undesirable Irish pubs. The room we had was small but functional. There is no proper restaurant here although they serve an incredibly expensive breakfast for $34 pp. The bar facility is only open during breakfast service and reopens at 4pm Until 11pm. We arrived late in the evening, consequently we were unable to get a drink and a snack after our 12 hour Amtrak journey from Canada. We went out to find something to eat and drink but gave up as there was nothing open nearby except the two pubs. Personally I consider this hotel to be  nothing but rooms with a reception.

title: As usual for Westgate, the service we received was amazing
text: Kevin at the front desk was absolutely the very best!  We stayed here only one night and we were upgraded to a suite on the 20th floor with a king bed, sofa, separate dressing area and very large marble bath...not to forget to mention the balcony with a table and four chairs!!!  The weather was perfect for sitting outside and just lounging that evening.  It was clean and perfect.  I stopped by the desk when we got back from dinner and asked them to make up the sofa for the third person in our room and not five minutes later...they appeared!  I have never been to a Westgate that did not have the very best service!  Beautiful hotel and I will definitely stay there again!  My normal stay in NYC is the Waldorf, but since they are closed for a couple years, I stayed here!  So very glad I did!!  Thank you Kevin for all your kindness!!

title: Fantastic!
text: We visited from the 11th to the 16th, I travelled alone with my 10 yr old daughter and cannot fault this hotel!It was perfectly located for Times Square and Grand central. The hotel is full of character and spotlessly clean. The staff are helpful especially Chafik the doorman who was a delight to talk to. Be warned the drinks are pricey, and you do have to pay $100 security deposit. I’ve read some complaints about the wi fi, but your in NY why would you want to sit on the internet?Will definitely be returning, my daughter started crying when we had to check out! Thank you Westgate for making our trip even more fabulous!

title: Amazing service. Large complicated group all taken care of beautifully
text: We had lots of disabled people coming from all over the world, including at one time lots of them coming in at once. We were totally looked after - Chafik professionally sorted out taxis to the airport and coordinated them (again, multiple journeys at once) and Bernice and Charmaine in sales and Christina and Kevin on the front desk were constantly and consistently kind and patient with me. They all treated us like friends, supported people needing assistance and couldn't do enough. Would and will indeed recommend.

title: Pulito e centralissimo
text:
Hotel molto pulito, con ottimo staff tutto funziona alla perfezione ,vicino alla reception un area per fare colazione con cibo di qualità,l’hotel è posizionato in una posizione davvero strategica vicino alla stazione centrale di New York praticamene scarsi 400mt a piedi ed una fermata da Times Square (raggiungibile anche con 20 minuti a piedi).
Considerando i prezzi di New York tipo una birra dai 9 dollari a salire , rapporto qualità/prezzo ottimo

title: Convention
text: Jose the door man provided excellent service in assisting people in and out of the hotel. I was extremely satisfied with his service and we will return to the west gate hotel because of the excellent service we received.

title: $340 a Night & WiFi Extra!!!
text: Let's face it. We are living in 2019 not 1999 - so the receptionist told me that Wifi in the room was extra I did a double take. This is just a plain rip off and there is no excuse for it nowadays...especially when the room costs so much. Small room too for the money. Glad I didn't bring the cat. Couldn't have swung it...

title: Solo stay
text: A large, extra spacious & comfortable room. Walkability to Grand Central Station was good. Check in & check out processes were simple & efficient. Every staff member I interacted with was happy to help & seemed happy to be working at the Westgate. Wished that my stay were longer.

title: Charged twice, appalling customer service
text:
Now I don’t usually leave reviews but unfortunately I have been left pretty desperate and with no choice by this hotel. The stay was fine. Basic hotel, gym, slightly dated but fine.
On arrival I was told I would be charged 100 dollars holding fee. Fine. 
I have just arrived back in the UK and tried to pay for my shopping and my debit card was declined. After checking my online banking it is clear that I have been charged two different amounts by the hotel (£852 and £802). When I booked the hotel on booking.com I agreed to pay £723.
I immediately called the hotel (no email address available). I was passed to about 3 different people. Not one could help me or explain why this money had been taken. The gentleman in finance eventually said there was nothing he could do. I would have to wait 7 days to see if one of these payment would be refunded. If I wanted a refund sooner I needed to send him the fax number of my bank so that he could send them a letter to tell them about the issue. 
Customer service appalling, they were absolutely hopeless and I am currently £900 out of pocket and being charged a daily overdraft fee. 
Do not stay here and certainly do not give them your bank details to take out unauthorised payments. They cannot be trusted!

title: Decent Hotel
text: Stayed for 4 nights as part of our 3 city trip to the USA celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. New York was our first stop and we went for a hotel that what was a decent price. We have to say that we were more than happy with the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and our room right great. We wanted to take the bed and pillows with us as they were so comfy. The location is great with Grand Central Station a few minutes walk away. If you want a nice clean and friendly hotel without paying stupid money, this is the place and we would definitely go back. Thank you Westgate for a great start to our trip.

title: Super tolles Hotel
text:
Dieses Hotel war ein Glücksfall für uns sehr zentral gelegen! Nur 5 Min zum Grand Station von wo aus man durch ganz New York, Manhatten und Brooklyn fahren kann!
Der Service hervorragend! Hilfe in jeder Lage!

title: 3 day stay
text: Found the hotel was clean and functional for us its sat in a good place a stones throw from Chrysler building  and grand central station so hopping on and of the underground made getting around easy the staff were polite and helpful but found the guys that helped with luggage etc kind of hung around wanting  tips for everything i would stay there again tho

title: I’m Impressed!
text: When my husband and I first arrived, we were greeted directly at curbside with a friendly and inviting greeting from Bell Service; Jose who made us feel welcomed, and insisted he handle our bags for us. This just started off the weekend right for us, he was the very first impression of the property, and he made a good one! Throughout our stay, the room was very nice, yet there were minor improvements that need to be made. We did learn that the hotel is under renovation, so we did take that into consideration. Our last night there, we decided to skip the city life and stay on property. We took advantage of the in house bar, and had a great bartender; Sam, who didn’t hesitate to make any drink we came up with lol Such a friendly attitude. And to seal off our trip, Ty; in housekeeping, was very helpful and educated us about the property. Ty made sure there was nothing we were lacking, to make sure my husband’s first visit to NYC was a success! He kept a smile on his face and was so friendly (despite him being a Giants fan lol GO COWBOYS) :-) Overall we didn’t have 1 complaint about the property and definitely will be visiting again soon. How can we not, with service like this! Thanks you guys for a wonderful stay!

title: Very nice hotel
text: Ideal location, just around the corner from Grand central station.  Hotel was clean and staff very helpful especially the doormen. The room had 2 double beds which had the comfiest mattresses and pillows I have ever slept on.  Rooms were a little dated and basic but I didn’t expect more from New York. As there is so much to do the rooms were just to sleep in. Only complaint was if you wanted WiFi in your room it was $10 a day which is ridiculous. However WiFi is free in the lobby. Would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Ripped off...
text:
I booked a room for 4 people online in a 2 double bed room. We came to the hotel at 11am and dropped our bags off at the concierge. The desk attendant offered to assign us a bed since we would be checking in late after a full day of sight seeing. We happily agreed to this, so our booking was not somehow lost.
Upon returning to the hotel, we were given our keys and our room number. We arrived to our room and instead of 2 double beds, we were given 1 king bed. Nowhere in our booking did I agree to 1 king bed for 4 people. When I called the front desk, they acted like there was some maintenance issue. This is a blatant lie since our room was assigned to us at 11am. As consolation, they said they would either take $50 off of our $300 bill (which was only for 1 night!) or give us 2 breakfast vouchers. I had to argue my butt off to get 3 breakfast vouchers, but still feel like this was a huge rip off. I was given a room ultimately that I didn’t agree to and got a BS consolation. We have to be uncomfortable all night and only some of us can eat breakfast. Please avoid this place at all cost. They are liars and have the worst customer service.

title: Hotel de época, con muy buena ubicación
text:
Nos quedamos en hotel en mayo del 2019, y la realidad es que dado su costo, (que no es barato para nada), el hotel en si nos decepciono un poco con sus habitaciones pequeñas, y muy viejas. Todo estaba limpio, la cama es buena y buen baño, pero no es un hotel que te sorprenda.
Esta en plena etapa de refacción y actualización y a las 7 de la mañana empezaban a golpear y hacer ruido. Eso no esta muy bueno para un hotel.
La ubicación es muy buena, estas a cuadra y media de la estación y 4 o 5 cuadras largas de 5Ta Ave.

title: Greatest staff ever
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night! I actually missed booked my room for the night before and they honored it!!! They very friendly, and truly made my weekend worth it. And the terrace room was great!

title: Westgate May 2019
text:
Decent hotel, good location, 10mins to Grand Central Station. Staff were nice. 

Only issues were: $10 per night for WiFi, gets pretty expensive if staying for a week, wifi in the lobby wasn't great. Found this an issue especially when trying to sort things out for holiday. This is the first hotel where I have had to pay for WiFi.
Other issues were, no glasses in the room to drink from.

title: Great stay
text:
After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive about staying at the Westgate but I have to say I was very impressed! Room was big enough for the two of us, clean and well equipped. For some reason we got free WiFi for the entirety of our stay - not sure if we were lucky or if this is something they’re trialing.

Staff were really friendly, location was good - easy to walk to all the spots needed, about 20 mins to Times Square but area felt very safe and a pleasant walk.

Overall would definitely recommend this hotel. It’s getting a refit at the end of the year so I’d be very happy to come back when it’s all updated.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text:
This hotel is near of everything in Midtown. You can walk for example to 5th avenue, Central Park, New York public Library,  Times Square etc only in 5-15 minutes.

Hotel was very clean and the room was big. Bed was very comfy! We had also balcony and the view was absolutely beautiful!

And that price! It was very cheap hotel in NYC, staff was very helpful and nice. We just loved this place and we can come back there at any time!

title: quiet and central to most locations
text:
very nice older hotel, staff were very helpful, room are cosy and clean.  Bed was very nice and crisp.  windows are small so you don't get much view from rooms, but then why do you want to stay inside with all the sites to see.   Food in area is very accessible.  2 blocks to the United Nations,  3 blocks to Grand Central station, 10 block to Time Square. 
recommend this hotel if you are not looking for nothing to fancy.

title: Three nights visiting friends
text: Hotel is perhaps not as grand as its website portrays it but it is well located, clean and tidy with helpful staff. Our room like many in New York was quite small and compact, the air con worked well, it was clean and the bed was comfortable but again not as big as you expect usually in the USA. The room did not have a safe and although there was a coffee machine there was no free small bottles of water which you find in many 4 star hotels. WiFi in the room costs $10 but was free in the lobby so you find lots of people in lobby using the wifi which does mean that it is sometimes slow to get online. We used the Starbucks in the lobby for breakfast which was cheaper then booking the included breakfast. Overall a little bit tired but an OK hotel

title: Bra hotell
text:
Du blir varmt välkomnad vid entren av entrepersonalen. Det är fina rum. Bra hjälpsam och trevlig personal. Kaffemaskin på rummet. Dock dåligt gym, finns löpband och ”walking” maskin. Sedan bara hantlar. Långt ifrån fullutrustat gym. 
Bastun och den relaxen såg bra ut

title: Very happy with this hotel and its location.
text:
We are just back from a four day stay at this hotel. I was a little concerned at some of the reviews on here but need not have worried. We found the staff from reception to the door men to be pleasant and efficient. The room was cleaned every day with bed made and fresh towels. We did not try breakfast at the hotel as the buffet breakfast was $35 per person. There are several places close by where a good breakfast can be had for $10 or less. I would recommend Johns Diner for a real American breakfast experience. Three was a coffee machine, Iron and Ironing board and a hair dryer in the room. We had a comfortable bed and there was no loud noises from Air con or lifts or other guests. Overall a very enjoyable stay. 
My only complaint would be that there was not internet in the rooms unless you paid a $10 per night surcharge. I note that this has been mentioned repeatedly in other reviews and that the management say each time that they are taking note of the comments and still do absolutely nothing about it.

title: Lovely staff
text: I really enjoyed staying here in March the staff were great very helpful  ready explain anything I wanted to know about New York .  The rooms are lovely but it would be useful to know to use the coffee machine .They also assisted with my luggage and called a taxi when I was leaving kindly agreed to take my picture

title: This hotel has everything you need and close to any place you need to go!
text:
I just took a cab from the airport and arrived at hotel at 7:30 a.m. with an afternoon check-in. They let me check-in then without any fees. I had to go to a nearby embassy and to my great surprise this hotel in Midtown is the Coolist place and is walking distance to Time Square, the United Nations, and the Empire State Building. If you don't want to walk just step outside and take a quick taxi ride. The doorman will fetch it for you and he knows them all. 

If you have a voucher they have an awesome breakfast buffet in a dining area.

The front lobby is lovely and then you walk into an open area with large working tables for business meetings or to set up your computer and get to work.  There are comfy chairs to sit on in the same area with tables to put your "Starbucks" coffee on and a variety of foods to choose from instead of going out to grab food. Yes, they have a mini-Starbucks and food bar  and I was able to get my daily latte! 

I went up to my room and just wanted to crash. It is contemporary, modern and so cozy. Beautiful! Spotless! 

The Westgate Grande is one block from the Westin. So grateful I booked here. They will hold your luggage before check-in and after check-out. Save yourself a couple a hundred bucks and spend it on something you really want to do or buy!

title: Basic Hotel
text:
This hotel is ideally situated for a 10 minute walk to Times Square and had a very comfy bed and is clean. Bathroom was a good size and had plenty of hot water. These are the only good bits about this hotel. The room itself was so small the desk chair only just pulled out before hitting the bed. Our view from our box room was a bathroom in the building opposite and the light in the wardrobe kept turning on constantly throughout the night. 

On arrival we were told we had to pay a $100 deposit incase of damage (we booked through BA and this was not stated. Also checked their website and could not find this information) I then found they had charged a $150 holding deposit to my card and when I enquired I was told well it should be $250 so I should count myself lucky and all hotels in US charge a fee so I should have expected this. Having never travelled to the US before how am I expected to know without being informed?

Wouldn't bother paying for breakfast $36 per person when there are loads of local diners around where you can get breakfast for two people at $20 or less.

title: Nice hotel 1 block from Grand Central Terminal
text: I found the staff very courteous, the room very clean ( not musty like some reviews stated). The carpets looked new. The bathroom was done completely in marble and also was very clean. Great location for us! The only thing that was a little loud was the heating system. We were always greeted with a smile from everyone we encountered. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Fue una grata estadía, el hotel presta muy buen servicio. Cómodo, limpio y bien decorado.
La ubicación es buena, aunque hoteles que compiten con él (como el Pennsylvania) están mejor ubicados. No hay mucho por la zona y a la noche los negocios cierran temprano. Está a unas 8 cuadras de Time Square y a 4 de Grand Central.
Lo malo es que se cobraba u$s 9.99 por día el wi fi, me parece excesivo y a 2019 debería estar ya incluido. Tampoco me gustó que se quedaran con una garantía de u$s 100.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Conocía el hotel por haberme hospedado cuando pertenecía a otra cadena, y la verdad me sorprendí para bien. Desde ya que la ubicación es perfecta, cerca de Grand Central, 5th Avenue y Times Square, pleno midtown. Las habitaciones standard no son gigantes  pero sí cómodas, espaciosas y bien equipadas, lo mismo el baño. Perfecta higiene, todo impecable. Y a precio módico por todo lo que ofrece. Ah! el personal de recepción, maleteros, etc, todos muy correctos.

title: Disappointing, not worth the money.
text: We paid $1800 AUD for 7 nights, which I knew going into this trip not to expect much for that price. First impressions - there are stairs to go up when you arrive, luggage and stairs are not compatible, wonder what they would have done if we had a guest that was in a wheelchair. The room was okay, we had a twin room on the 3rd floor. The noise from the room next door was insane, kept us up all night. We think it was a laundry or something. I would never stay here again, the elevators were rickety and old, the store closes when they feel like it, the shower/bath is horrible to use, this place is extremely outdated. Staff are not willing to do much to help you when concerns are raised. Honestly wish I had saved my money and gone somewhere else. It's about a 10 minute walk to Grand Central and has barely any restaurants around it. Not a great location however besides the noise from our floor it was a quiet place. (Ps, the toilet paper was on the other side of the room from the toilet...so odd.)

title: First stay
text: First stay and would stay again , lovely clean hotel , friendly staff . Comfortable beds and roomy for New York. Only let down you have to pay for your WiFi where a lot of hotels offer this amenity free . At the same would stay again for cleanliness and good location.

title: Delighted
text: My wife and I are just back from a wonderful week in New York City where we stayed at the WestGate Hotel.  Our stay at the WestGate was excellent and enhanced by the helpful and friendly staff.  The location is perfect with fine restaurants within very easy walking distance.  Grand Central Station is only a few blocks away.  The hotel itself is a designated historical site with a beautifully kept entrance reminiscent of an earlier, more elegant time.  The rooms are clean and well-kept with all of the needed amenities.  The only negative is their wanting to charge $10 a night for WiFi, but free WiFi is available at the walk-in restaurant directly across the street.

title: Sub-par hotel - deposit not returned
text:
My partner and I visited this hotel in February and I have to say it was really disappointing.

Room was expensive but very small, two drinks at the bar cost $60 and they ask for a $100 deposit when you check in (which we were not pre-warned of), we left the room in perfect condition and two weeks later still haven't received it. 

Disgusting!

title: Meh
text: Nice looking and clean hotel. They have “free” WiFi in the lobby but it is essentially not usable. Nearly impossible to connect so when I needed WiFi it was easier to walk down the street to Starbucks. Ok if you just need a place to sleep but there are better options than here

title: Very nice hotel with excellent service
text: Check in was smooth and the room we got was nice, but the hot water did not work unless you run the faucet/shower for about 20 min or more. The manager quickly moved us to another room which was also an upgrade. The location is very good, a short walk around the corner to a wonderful deli (La Pleroma) and short walk to grand central station. I didn’t like that the rooms don’t have a fridge and wifi is only available in the lobby - if you want wifi in your room, you have to pay $10/day.  Breakfast at the hotel is expensive at $28/per person, but there is a great diner nearby on Lexington called Scotty’s. I would stay here again as the rooms are very clean and spacious, but I think at the very least Internet should be included for guests.

title: Some quirks but good overall
text: We stayed here on a Christmas visit to NYC. The price was great for the location and the season. It is quite a ways off the beaten path but still only about a mile from both Times Square and Rockefeller Center. It is also very close to Grand Central. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The room is very tiny...typical for NYC, but one of the smaller ones I’ve stayed in when I’ve staying in the city honestly. Also our thermostat never seemed to work correctly. It was always either extremely hot or cold - no regulation. It didn’t seem to do anything when you adjusted it. Also the shower is incredibly quirky...it had to have instructions on the wall with how to turn it on which I thought was weird. Other things to note are the WiFi isn’t free...it didn’t bother me per se since I have unlimited data but I know that’s important to a lot of people. Also valet parking is $65 and upon some research you could possibly self park for cheaper so if thats important to you do your research on that. Lastly there’s a $35 breakfast buffet...I didn’t partake due to price but it looked fairly average. Overall it was a decent stay despite a few quirks.

title: Great value!
text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and value of the Westgate. It's been recently renovated so it was clean and well-kept.. The lobby is long and narrow with small seating areas and tables and chairs where you can do some work or have coffee. The room was spacious for New York City, The shower had a marked temperature control, the bed was comfortable, the heat worked well. Free wi-fi was an important and appreciated amenity. Located at 42nd Street and 2nd Ave. it's walking distance from Grand Central and the UN. It was quiet, not crowded - a nice respite from the bustle of the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. I especially appreciated that they warned me that there was construction going on in the building and that it might start early in the morning. Many hotels wouldn't have said anything.I highly recommend the Westgate if the Midtown-East is where you need to be.

title: Great place to stay and feel good.
text: It was the first time we stayed at this hotel, we had already stayed in other New York hotels on previous trips. Westgate Hotel is very well located, close to Gran Central, great service, friendly and attentive staff, very comfortable. Clean and spacious room with a great bathroom. If there is another opportunity, we would definitely stay there again.

title: 国連ビルの近く。立地も良く、中レベルの手頃のホテル。
text: 空港からタクシーで行ったのでわかりましが、大通りに面しているものの、奥に広く入り口は狭いので分かりにくいと思います。客室は広くきれいで問題ありません。部屋にはドリップ式のコーヒーが数種類と外に持ち出せるカップが置いてあるのはありがたかったです。朝食もメニューの種類はおおくありませんが、ベーグルなど美味しかったです。他にも日本人が泊まっていました。

title: Great Stay
text:
We had a really lovely stay at this hotel.  

We had a nice spacious room with exceeded expectations having read some of the picky reviews.  The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.

The location is good and within walking distance to lots a famous landmarks and attractions. If you don't like walking,  there is a bus stop outside and a subway stop close by.

There are lots of bars, restaurants and coffee shops within a 5 min walk.  

I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: disappointed
text: We booked a suite. I called to verify the bathroom was not in the bedroom but between the bedroom and living area. Confirmed, but when we arrived it wasn't the case. The hotel was old. It wasn't very private between rooms. When walking by the front desk there were often people complaining. Location was nice. Room was large, especially for NYC.

title: Stayed December 2018
text: I stayed here with my husband and daughter for 4 days Dec 18, we had a great time and enjoyed the Christmas period. The hotel staff were lovely with a quick check in and check out and free WiFi! It’s only a couple of minutes walk (15-20minw) to Times Square also. The rooms are basic as always in NYC however a little bigger than where we stayed before so that was a surprise! I found the hotel to be clean which is the main thing, we had no issues! Jose (the door guy) was so welcoming and friendly, even got us an umbrella for our walk as it was raining and always helping us with our bags or the taxi door, he also recommended some nice places to eat. He made us feel important every time as we were in and out constantly and always had a smile on his face to brighten up our day! Would definetly recommend this hotel!

title: Great location!
text:
Easy to grab 42nd st bus right out the front door. Walking distance to Grand Central, Library, Bryant Park, Times Square, etc.

Jose the doorman was wonderful.  Very friendly and welcoming.  

Water in shower never got hot and heater in room was difficult to regulate, but otherwise great experience.

title: THE ROOM BOOKED AND PAID FOR NOT PROVIDED
text: We had a "King Bed - Signature Room" booked at the Westgate the first week of December.  When we checked in, a very small double-bed room was given to us.  When I showed the clerk the paperwork where a different room was booked and paid for (well over $300 per night), the clerk stated she could do nothing but change our room the next day.  We repacked and were given the appropriate room the next day.  Although the hotel acknowledges they did not provide the correct room, the refuse to refund and difference.

title: Bigger than expected!
text:
Just returned last night from a one night stay at this hotel. It was perfect for what we wanted and needed. After all, it being the holidays and being in Manhattan we expected to pay for the location and convenience. We were arriving at Grand Central by train so the hotel was a very easy 3 block walk on the east side. It was centrally located and an easy walk to 5th ave, St PAt's Radio City, Rockefeller Center, etc. We arrived around noon and Mike, at the luggage area, happily took our bags and was quiet personable asking us if we needed anything. All was said with a smile as well.

The only issue we had was that when we went to check in about 2:45pm we were told the room wasn't ready and we could be given a different room. That was fine. Took the keys and went to the room only to find out they didn't work. Back down to the front desk who apologized and recoded the room key. The keys worked but we were shocked that there was already someone else's luggage in the room! We quickly went back to the front desk and this time were given a room on the 17th floor and everything worked fine.

The room was quite large and extremely clean and well laid out. Closet with safe, ironing board, coffee maker, TV and plenty of outlets for plugging in. A private bathroom was really the selling point. Wifi was said to be charged in rooms but was available free. 

There were plenty of places to eat nearby so we didn't buy the $35 breakfast buffet. That was a little on the high side we thought but there were many options nearby. 

Definitely would stay there again. Service at the front desk was quick and other than the check in issue, it was more than we hoped for.

title: Surprising pearl in the middle
text:
First time in this hotel after staying in dozens of others and this was a very nice surprise.
Friendly staff, great rooms which are far from being "outdated". Everything is well maintained and clean.
Water stream in the shower could use a little help there as well as the amenities but altogether this was a very good experience and i do recommend this hotel either for couples on holidays, families and of course for business trips.

title: Just ok
text: This hotel is on east 42nd street but close enough to Times Square to walk to and from. The hotel is just average. Small rooms and my room had a alley view that was anything but good. Hot water wasn’t abundant so shower early in the day. Was within walking distance to my conference hotel is the reason I stayed here.

title: Lovely Stay
text: Stayed in this hotel with family for a weekend in the city.  Shared a double room with my husband and two, school-age girls.  The hotel itself was lovely.  Our room was clean and more than adequate.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Heating and A/C were a bit difficult and confusing to control, and both the sink and bathtub drained very slowly.  However, everything else was great.  Did not use on site parking or transportation from the hotel directly.  There is a daily internet fee for in-room wifi.  Would stay again.

title: Still transitioning from Hilton
text: Nice hotel - boutique style, rooms have character and are not standard.  Hotel is well kept, and staff is very friendly.  Great location next to Grand Central and definitely a nice place to stay.  Not much in the way of the restaurant / mostly just a help yourself type store where you buy and do what you need.  I had a queen bedroom that was quite quaint and nicely appointed.   I would stay again.

title: Anita
text: Hotel was great. Room very clean. Coffee making facilities in room. Staff very helpful . location close to Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station,  we found it easy to walk to United Nations, Empire State, Times Square and eas then to get on bus tours if you wish to go further afield.

title: SU PRECIO, SITUACIÓN, LIMPIEZA
text: El hotel ha cumplido nuestras expectativas. Viajamos en la semana del puente de la Constitución y los precios de los hoteles eran todoooos desorbitados, pero mire día tras día hasta que encontré este hotel a la mitad de precio de todos los que había visto, en internet aparece como Hilton Midtown New York, luego nos informaron del cambio de nombre que había tenido el hotel. La limpieza era diaria, cambio de toallas, gel, champú.... en el hall del hotel  tienen una cafetería ( el café es de sturbucks) estaba muy bien. Su ubicación era muy buena, se encuentra a unos 15 min  de Times Square, 3 min de la estación central, el edificio Chrysler está al lado. Conclusión es muy buena alternativa.

title: Dott.
text:
Sconsigliato!!!!!!!!
Premetto che ho fatto parecchi viaggi, e soggiorno sempre e solo in strutture con minimo 4 stelle
Quest’albergo in Base ai miei canoni ne dovrebbe avere solo 2!
Camere ANGUSTE, cassaforte APPOGGIATA all’interno di un LOCUKO che funge anche da armadio
Frigo bar ASSENTE (inconcepibile in alberghi di detta categoria) finestre NON insonorizzare
INTERNET A PAGAMENTO!!!!!!!!

title: Who needs light
text: My room is on 7th floor and has 2 tiny windows that look out onto nothing at all.  Yes, that is right, its like having no windows at all.  It is impossible to tell if it is night or day outside let alone what the weather is like.  At $300 per night, this is not a budget option but honestly  is a really terrible experience.  The room is small, the bathroom absurdly outdated, the bath itself is tiny with an awful plastic show curtain. Hotel facilities are none at all really (breakfast buffet is as far as it goes.  They try to charge extra for wifi access,

title: Trip
text: Hotel was clean   staff all over were very helpful and friendly , rooms clean every day with fresh towels   over all a plesant stay at the westgate   , i would return to this hotel but maybe look for somthing a bit closer to times sqaure next time

title: One night stay
text:
I stayed here with a friend who lives is US, she had stayed before. 
We have a lovely room on the 17th floor which had a sitting room, bedroom and bathroom.
Room was clean and spacious with everything we needed. Bathroom was big with lots of marble, there was a large crack in the marble countertop around the sink which could be an issue for cleaning it.
Only negative was cost of breakfast, we walked up the road to get something to eat as we felt it was quite pricey. 
Good central location within walking distance of most of the main sites. 
We could see the river through the buildings

title: vacanza eccellente
text: Ho soggiornato in questa struttura per 3 giorni,devo dire che essendo la terza volta che trascorro qualche giorno di vacanza in questa grande metropoli sono pienamente soddisfatta di questo albergo.Alla reception si trovano persone pronte a soddisfare ogni richiesta,perchè molto preparate,ambiente molto bello e pulito,il wi- fi è gratis e non è applicata nessuna tassa di soggiorno.Complimenti al personale al quale è affidata la pulizia delle camere e quelli a cui è affidato il servizio delle colazioni.Il prezzo della colazione è allineato ai prezzi che si trovano fuori,se tornerò nella Grande Mela sicuramente tornerò in questo albergo!!!( dimenticavo  .....ho soggiornato dal 7 novembre al 10 ).

title: Stay somewhere else
text: I know this is one of the cheaper hotels in NYC but I would still expect more for $250 a night. The lobby is nice, the staff was friendly upon arrival and we were able to check in early which was great. When we got to the room, the bed looked very tiny, we were supposed to have a queen and this definitely looked like a full so I called the front and was informed that hotel queen size beds are just a little smaller than a normal queen. Whatever, no problem, it was only one night. We dropped our bags off in the room, the room had a somewhat funky smell and was warm so we opened a window and went out for a few hours. We are not by picky by any means, and it takes a lot for me to complain or write a bad review, however, when we came back to the room I noticed that next to the bed there was a pair of dirty men's underwear that didn't belong to my husband. I thought this was pretty disgusting. I brought them to the front desk in a plastic bag and they simply said "okay, thank you". I asked if our room had been cleaned after the last guest because if it had, how did a pair of underwear end up staying in the room? They said, "if you want us to call housekeeping and have them re-clean your room, we can, but it was definitely cleaned, your bed was made wasn't it?" I thought this was all pretty bizarre. I expected a very different reaction, at least an apology. I booked the room through hotwire and wonder if maybe that's why we were treated this way. We still paid $250 for the room and expected a clean room at the least. I would not go back.

title: Adeqate but could do better
text:
We stayed in a twin bed room on 11 floor for 3 nights.
The room was clean and well maintained by housekeeping. It was very cold outside but we were unable to increase the room temperature higher than 69 degrees.
The bathroom had no heating and was freezing cold. There is a heater under the sink but it looked so old and was falling apart. Obviously not working.
We were worried about hot water having read previous reviews, but this was not an issue.
Location is OK  3 blocks from Grand central and about 6 blocks to Times square.
We went out each day for breakfast, there are a number of diners in the area.
Wifi was only available in the lobby , nothing in the rooms which is very unusual these days.
If you have booked transfers make sure the company knows it is a Westgate now as some still refer to it as a Hilton.

title: Nice stay
text: Due to unexpected snow storm I stayed in NYC after work. Hotel is nice, clean, and very friendly and helpful staff. Check-in was smooth and my room was large and roomy, sometimes in NYC the rooms are very small. The only thing that were small were the elevators, but there are three of them, so wait wasnt too long. I've stayed in most hotels in the area over the past few years, and this hotel is in my top 3.

title: Quaint Hotel -- Loved It
text: Hubby and I visited with adult children and loved the hotel. The employees were great and the rooms/hotel had a wonderful ambiance. It's walking distance and a straight shot from Time Square, United Nations and Broadway Shows.

title: Nov 2018 in New York
text:
My wife & I booked a multi centre holiday with British Airways ( Vegas & then New York ), when we booked the trip the New York Hotel was a Hilton Hotel. After booking we were notified that Westgate had in fact taken over the running of the Hotel, we were given the option to change this however we just decided to go along with the original booking that BA had put together for us.
We checked into the Westgate Hotel quite late at night & wasn't impressed from the start, we were given room 503 which we wasn't impressed with as there was a lot of noise running through the heating pipes & the toilet cistern handle was hanging off, also the room was quite dingy to look at. I immediately requested another room, we were then given room 323 which was actually a bit better, however still quite dingy to look at.
Having said that the bed was very comfortable & we did sleep very well, the towels were changed on a daily basis, we didn't experience any issues with the hot water.
Overall I would say that the hotel location is fine but the hotel itself is in desperate need of refurbishment, we certainly wouldn't stay in this hotel again until its been upgraded.

title: Old Hotel with Character
text:
A lot of these reviews are deceiving.  After reading them I was very nervous for my stay at this hotel.  Our flight was later in the evening, but check in was a breeze, super quick and easy.  All of the staff was so friendly and helpful.  It is an older hotel so it will have its creaks and outdated parts, but our room was very clean and well taken care of, and a decent size compared to most rooms in the city.  I lived in NYC for 6 years, so I know what average room size is like.  

If you want modern, this is not the hotel for you, but it's a classic and I enjoyed my stay thoroughly.

title: Aprobado alto, casi notable
text:
La ducha es fija.
Yo las prefiero de teléfono.
Me resultan mucho más cómodas.
Me parece excesivo que se queden con una fianza de 300 $ cuando ya pagaste y tienen tu carta de crédito. Te los devuelven a los pocos días de regresar a tu país no en el momento de irte.
Son los únicos puntos negativos que encuentro teniendo en cuenta que mi estancia era solamente alojamiento y no utilicé comedor.

La ubicación es buena.
Es un lujo estar en la calle 42 cerca de la Estación Central con Metro a todos lados.
Las personas de recepción que hablaban español fueron muy amables (cosa que no puedo decir del resto, bastante secos)
La habitación era amplia y confortable.

title: Read Before Booking
text:
We travelled as a party of 3 to New York in October 2018.  We booked our flights and hotel as a package via British Airways.  We booked and paid to stay at The Hilton in New York but discovered about two months later that they had sold the hotel to the Westgate Group.  I contacted BA to change hotels but they would not authorise this.  This hotel is busy because of its location and previous trading name.  The hotel looks grand enough at street level and indeed, in the Reception Area.  Once you venture upstairs via the lifts to the rooms, you become aware of how dated this hotel has become.  We had a room on the 4th floor with 2 double beds.  The beds were very comfortable, however, the heating did not work well and when it did it was extremely noisy.  You could not sleep through this noise.  The bathroom, which has no heating at all, was absolutely freezing with a single mouldy pane of glass to the outside.  There was a filthy broken air heater under the wash hand basins that has probably not worked in the past 20 years.  THE HOT WATER SUPPLY IS A BIG ISSUE.  We had to call maintenance up to our room every night so help sort it out.  The first night, we ran the hot tap for 20 minutes and still there was no hot water.  The second night, we were told we hadn't turned the tap as far as it would go and the third night we were actually told off for calling him again when we still couldn't get hot water.  The bathroom was also not clean.  

We also spent a lot of money on taxis getting back to the hotel at the end of each day, so I am not sure it was in the best location for our particular needs but the weather was also not in our favour and we would probably have walked more if we had stayed in the spring or summer.  

We found the reception & concierge staff to be helpful and polite.

title: Sottoscala
text: Camera piccola, praticamente un sottoscala. Letto comodo ma piccolo. Pulizia appena soddisfacente Bagno ancora più piccolo. Impossibile spegnerela'aria condizionata. Pessimo servizio clienti. Non consiglio

title: Prima hotel
text:
Het hotel heeft prima kamers. Deze zijn ruim en s choon. De badkamer is gedateerd.
Bijzonder is dat er slechts gratis wifi is in de lobby terwijl.in heel New York buiten voorzien wordt van internet. Betalen voor 5 mb per dag a 14.99 dollar vind ik dan ook niet passen bij de internet maatschappij van tegenwoordig

title: Great Location
text: We stayed at The Westgate hotel for two nights last weekend. We arrived later Friday night, we got room 1703. We left or bags and went out for a drink. when we came back the room was freezing it seemed to have two vents working, one directly onto of the bed, we couldn't adjust the temperature so we called the front desk. Within two minutes Kaz was at the door. Smiling so helpful he fixed the problem Kaz deactivated the outer vent (our room was in the last floor) and fixed the AC unit. We were so grateful he also fetched an extra blanket for us :) The room was clean and confortable but the bathrooms are in GREAT need of updating. At check out, Kevin was a complete gentleman.What a great service he and Kristina gave us. Thank you.

title: Comfortable hotel in "interesting" location
text:
I stayed here twice, both times for two nights. First time was Wednesday to Friday, then away for a week and back for Friday to Sunday.

The first visit was during the start of the new session at the United Nations, when lots of foreign heads of state and VIPs are in town. The hotel was just inside the police security perimeter so no vehicles were allowed on that section of E42nd Street, however my hotel booking allowed me through the pedestrian barrier. The hotel seemed to be full and the room price I paid reflected that! A definite call out to Michael who helped out with my luggage and also sorted out a car to take me to Newark at the end of my stay.

The second stay the roads were back to normal and the UN had finished. The hotel room price was more reasonable this visit.

Both visits the rooms were clean, and the bed comfortable - I slept well. Breakfast in the "Tudor Marketplace" restaurant in the hotel was okay, but I did not feel it was worth $34. The scrambled eggs were solid and dried out all 4 mornings, and the orange juice appeared (and tasted) to be from a supermarket low price range; the coffee was okay.

One gripe is the hotel wifi. In this day and age I do not expect to pay extra for the "privilege" of accessing the Internet! Depending on speed required, it costs between $9.99 and $14.99 per day. I have not paid for this anywhere else during my stay in the US, and quite frankly it is outrageous.

Fix the wifi and improve the breakfast and I would have no hesitation giving a rating of 4/5.

title: Disappointing
text: Location not bad near the East River on 42nd Street but the hotel is dated, recently taken over by Westgate Group. There is no hot water in the evenings and while we were there none in the morning 'til they moved us to a room on a lower floor. The breakfast is unnecessarily expensive. The staff are helpful but room prices vary. BEWARE - we booked through Expedia, who claimed we were getting 50% off. However, prices quoted on the web, when we were putting the location into our device, were some $100 a night less. Although they agreed with these figures, the hotel said they could not alter our charges because we'd booked through a third party! Room was smallish, bed was comfy, everything was clean. Prices are for a better hotel than this is.

title: 見つけるのに大変でした。
text: グランドセントラル駅近くのヒルトンなら、宿泊当日にすぐ見つかるだろうと思っていたら全然見かけません。ストリートとアベニュー番地からと近所での聞き込みでやっと分かりました。名前にヒルトンがなく、WESTGATE NEW YORK CITYだったのです。沢山のヒルトンホテルに今まで宿泊してきましたが、こんなのは初めてでした。それなら、初めから予約時に示しておいて欲しいです。ホテルは、伝統を感じるクラシカルな建築で立地は抜群です。クライスラービルがいい大きさで眺められ、グランドセントラル駅に近いので買い物等、便利でした。

title: Terrible
text: I stayed here many many times when i travel to NY for work and it was a Hilton. I arrived late 11p. No food or room service option. Someone was having a cigar in their room next door, although I think it’s a smoke free hotel.  Room wifi10$. My room was so moist there was water dripping from the ceiling grates. I couldn’t shower as there was no hot water even when I let the water run into the tub and sink for 10 mins. Water was brown and undrinkable (...also tricky as there was not glassware to drink from but there is an ice bucket!), tv did not not work, very loud clunk from Wall about every hour so sleep is limited.  Bed was comfortable.  Morning bell person was happy and helpful with storing my bag. Won’t be back.

title: Da evitare
text: Premetto che non ho termini di paragone a Manhattan. Ciò detto, il primo indicatore di giudizio degli hotel sono i bagni che, in questo caso, sono angusti e vecchi, direi impresentabili per un 4 stelle. In secondo luogo gli interni non corrispondono a quelli pubblicizzati sul sito. Personale scortese. Non vicinissimo alla metro. Unica nota positiva la giusta temperatura degli ambienti ad agosto non troppo fredda, presumo, però, sia solo per risparmiare energia dei condizionatori.

title: Perfecte uitvalsbasis voor bezoek aan NYC
text: Bij aankomst bij ons hotel waren we meteen positief verrast. De ligging is super, op loopafstand van Times Square, 5th Avenue en Broadway maar net buiten de massale drukte. Personeel zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Wij reisden samen met onze 2 tieners en hadden een kamer met 2 double beds geboekt. Voor aankomst maakten we ons wat zorgen over de grootte van de kamer, maar ook hier werden we positief verrast. Voor NYC begrippen een ruime kamer, goede bedden en heel schoon. In het hotel is een koffiebar aanwezig waar Starbucks koffie wordt geserveerd. Buiten het hotel zijn veel mogelijkheden om te ontbijten, daarom geen gebruik gemaakt van het hotelontbijt.

title: Not good.
text: The location of the property is great with only a short bus/cab ride to Time Square. The lobby is ok. Breakfast buffet was ridiculously expensive so we ate ate a nearby cafe. Then there is the room. Walking in the carpet was dirty and the bathroom had hair on the sink and floor. Shower did not drain. Also, no free wi-fi. I believe we paid $15/day for internet that extremely slow. The "free" wi-fi in the lobby was no better.  The beds were comfortable enough. I will say the doormen are great. Still, I did not expect to get nickled and dimed  from a hotel that's not cheap . I suggest paying a little more and staying elsewhere.

title: Another fabulous stay at this hotel..
text: My mother and I  been to this hotel for the past six years (under previous ownership) and I must say that this year’s vacation was as good, if not better than previous years. Check in to the hotel was swift and we were given our room within a few minutes of arrival at the hotel. The hotel and rooms were clean and the staff as always, were friendly and courteous. A huge shout out goes to Jose and Chris who went out of their way to help and Sam in the Tudor kitchen who was always there with good advice on places to visit. Also to vic the GM, for the lovely cupcakes and card sent up to my room for my birthday. Another memorable birthday spend at this hotel and have already booked my stay for next year. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC!!

title: Desepcionada
text: Al realizar esta review, tengo varias opiniones encontradas: Empezaré por lo que menos me gustó: Por empezar llegamos tarde a la noche y nos atendió un señor llamado “Steven”, el cual nos atendió muy mal! No nos quería dejar ingresar a la habitación porque decía que nuestras tarjetas no estaban habilitadas, lo cual era falso, no solo porque las tarjetas black no necesitan habilitarse y son internacionales, sino porque teníamos 8 tarjetas de distintos bancos y según él ninguna funcionaba, por ende nos decía que teníamos que pagar si o si con efectivo. Nos negamos y le pedimos por favor ingresar a la habitación ya que habíamos tenido un viaje muy largo y eran las 2 am que mañana podríamos intentar nuevamente, pero se negó con muy malos tratos, hasta q logramos que nos acepte un depósito en efectivo en USD 200 (era el doble de lo que salía la habitación pero no nos dejaba ingresar con menos). Al otro día una chica muy amable nos atendió y nos devolvió el dinero nos dijo q la tarjeta con la q habíamos hecho la reserva había pasado perfectamente que no sabía porque habíamos tenido q pasar por tal mala situación. Otro punto en contra es que el wifi es gratuito solo en la recepción! Lo cual a esta altura con el avance tecnológico teniendo internet libre y gratuito en plena calle de Nueva York, no tiene sentido que no den wifi gratuito en la habitación. En cuanto a lo positivo, debo decir que la ubicación es muy buena, y la relación precio calidad por la zona que se encuentra también es muy buena. La habitación es muy linda, amplia y cómoda, solo un poco oscura en nuestro caso que teníamos una interna no se como serían las demas. El desayuno no está incluido, y el precio es caro por lo que ofrecen no lo recomiendo, y considero que debería estar incluido en la tarifa de la habitación, eso generaría una distinción positiva para el hotel de los otros hoteles de Nueva York. Por todo esto, es que recomiendo este hotel siempre y cuando tengan en cuenta y acepten los aspectos negativos que comenté anteriormente. O quizás los propios dueños del hotel lean está review y hagan un cambio que lo ayudará positivamente para que este hotel sea mucho mejor ya que le veo mucho potencial.

title: Poor Customer Service
text: Hotel was beautiful - old but modern. However, the desk service was rude and unhelpful. Our standard double room was not ready at 6pm. Was given a refund and was still charged full amount. The front desk manager was very accomodating and helpful but the staff was not.

title: It’s about the people..
text: Our first visit to NYC so didn’t know what to expect. Had to request a mini bar fridge to be delivered and the room was a little small. However calling out Jose the doorman and Sam in the eatery. Thanks for making the visit great..

title: Satisfied
text: Visited NYC for the Weekand, went to see a concert at MSG, visited a few sites and stayed at this hotel, it was a great hotel, excellent staff, very attentive to your needs. The rooms were comfortable which was amazing since we got it for a very low price. We’ll be visiting this hotel again.

title: decent place,  great location, friendly and helpful staff
text: Double room a bit small for two double beds, but otherwise has everything you would need.  Great location close to Grand Central Station surrounded by an array of good restaurant within walking distance. .  Friendly and pleasant and helpful staff.

title: Oh, Jose!
text:
We'd like to give a well deserved shout out to Jose The Doorman at the Westgate (formerly known as the Hilton / Manhattan, NY)!

THANK YOU for happily whistling us taxi's, even in the rain! And your recommendation to the bellissimo Osteria Laguna Restaurant just up the street was spot on!

We'll be back again, Jose! And thank you Westgate for another good experience! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

title: Terrific hotel in a great location for us
text:
We stayed at the Westgate in June - it had just converted from a Hilton a month ago.  We found out about the ownership change when we arrived - but we weren't worried because - as frequent travelers to the Orlando area - we know Westgate to be clean, comfortable, and reliable.

Our room blew us away!  It was amazing.  We had a king room with balcony, and we expected the typical NYC tiny room with, perhaps, a fire escape outside the window to stand on . . . we were dead wrong.  This was a private balcony that was probably 2/3 the size of our room!  We were surrounded by the buildings of Tudor City with glances of the East River beyond them.  We spent the beginning and ending of each day enjoying the great balcony.

Walking distance everywhere, and it's very convenient to be at 42nd and 2nd.  They've marketed themselves as being near Grand Central Station - it's relatively close, but I wouldn't tag it as a Grand Central hotel.  

Still, it's an easy walk to some great restaurants.  Bryant Park and the Library are close.  Times Square is a very easy walk.  But I'd recommend strolling the parks in Tudor City and trying some of the amazing restaurants up and down 2nd Avenue . . . 

When we come back to Manhattan, we'll definitely try to see if one of their balcony rooms might be available!

title: Good place
text:
This used to be Hilton East and it’s now Westgate. An old building on 2nd ave midtown, which makes the location great,  as you have grand central close by and the fifth at walking distance. 

Some people here complained about the staff friendliness, I can’t say they were super nice but they were efficient and helpful. I’d take that over niceness anytime. 

It’s true that the rooms are a bit aged, but I found them pleasant and all was working okay. 

WiFi is included only if you paid the “resort” tax. 

Would recommend and would stay again.

title: Clean and Convenient
text: I was really skeptical about booking this hotel through Priceline, but was pleasantly surprised by how clean the lobby, elevators, and hotel room were. Our hotel room was very small, but I didn't expect different from a midtown Manhattan hotel. The bed was very comfortable, and the location can't be beat. The only negative was that our flight into NYC was extremely delayed, and we finally got to the Westgate at 2:30am. We were told we had to wait 20-30 minutes to check in, because the computer system had to reboot. Needless to say, at that hour after prolonged travel, we were exhausted. I tried to ask for a room with a terrace in exchange for our having to wait in the middle of the night to check in, but was denied. In any case, it was a pleasant stay, and the staff was professional and courteous throughout our stay.

title: Ruined my stay in NYC
text: This hotel is not nearly worth as much as it costs to stay there and is nowhere near a four star hotel. Customer service is horrible as they complain for any small request, pictures are deceiving, they don’t understand their duties as a hotel and neither service the room or assist their guests as any hotel would and should. Their phones don’t work nor are set up with the adequate redirection so you have to use the hotel phone to call hotel as if you’re calling from any phone. Their answering machines still belong to the previous hotel, their carpets are extremely dirty and dusty and expect their guests to walk on it as they don’t provide slippers. I found a stain on every part of the bedding and towels, I contacted their manager to change my reservation and complain and she never got back to me after I left a voicemail, I requested that they change my sheets and they didn’t for two days- they only redid the bed, very dirty windows, I even had a cracked window, damaged furniture with scratches and stains filled with dust, dirty stained walls and doors, and the rooms reek. The WiFi also stops working randomly and they just kept saying they’re working on it but never fixed it. I also took a shower and 10 minutes in the smoke alarm went off and when I called the hotel they said oh it’s from the hot water when there was certainly nowhere close to being that hot for it to turn on a smoke alarm. Refer to my photos for proof of what I’m talking about. You will be disappointed, don’t stay here. Don’t let the price point make you think they will deliver the basics, they shamelessly won’t.

title: Amazing Hotel & Staff
text: During our trip we stayed in multiple hotels. By far this hotel was the best to stay in and had an amazing staff! They were always helpful and providing services when needed! The room was very spacious and had a beautiful balcony! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!!

title: Great hotel
text:
Lovely hotel, conveniently located by Grand Central Station. Rooms were extremely clean and comfortable however shower wasn’t too warm. 
Breakfast and wifi are additional. Surely in this day and age wifi should be included in hotel rates. I’d personally rather pay $10 extra a night and have it included than have to pay it as an additional fee. 
Reception staff were friendly and helpful but could do with improving their appearance (a hairbrush is a nice touch sometimes). 
All in all I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

title: Chambre humide et wifi non dispo dans les chambres
text:
J'ai passé une nuit dans cet hôtel, sur le site de réservation de l'hôtel, la chambre affichait une superficie de 32m2, or une fois arrivé, elle n'en faisait qu'à peine 20m2, ce qui reste raisonable.
