En revanche, le moquette bleu marine était sale (abondance de morceaux de papiers au sols), mais le plus dérangeant fût l'hygrométrie particulièrement élevé de la chambre. En effet là climatisation rejetait de l'air humide en forte quantité puisqu'elle était programmé à 20°C, ce qui est trop froid et très désagréable. Très vite, le sentiment que la chambre n'est pas saîne se fait ressentir, çe qui est dommage au but du prix de la chambre type Queen-Size (225€). 
À cela je précise que le wifi n'est pas dispo dans les chambres, il faut se contenter de surfer sur internet dans le hall de l'hôtel.

title: Was told to wait for room indefinitely
text: I booked two nights. Arrived around mid-night. Was told either has to wait for room or to be sent to another hotel for one night and come back to this hotel for the second night. The lady in the front desk was rather cold. She didn’t  even told us how long the wait would be. It was 1am. I was left deciding whether to drag the sleepy family to another hotel or wait in the lobby.....

title: Fantastic hotel
text: A week in newyork to do all of the sights and the formula e race.chose this hotel after research. Location fantastic, cleanliness A1, the rooms were excellent, with air con and all you would expect, in a lovely setting.the staff were excellent, helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable, and were very very proud of a good customer service. Concierge incredible, sorting out what we needed, and the price for the room and location was incredible. Well done to all, for good customer service, and an excellent location, stay here.

title: Great stay at a very good hotel
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Contrary to many of the reviews, we were more than pleased with our stay. 

The hotel has a very good location, near transportation and several attractions. The front desk and bellmen were friendly and polite. The check-in process was seamless and though we'd bid on a queen room on Priceline, the wonderful staff member at the front desk provided us with a king room. The lobby was well done, clean, and nicely decorated. The very nice king room was a good size, clean, and well furnished. The a/c in the room made it quite a cool retreat for breaks during several hot days. The floor we stayed on was quiet and we found the bed comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and spotlessly clean. 

There are several very good restaurants, coffee shops, and other amenities nearby (including a CVS and a Walgreens/Duane Reade). Likewise, the hotel is close to transportation including Grand Central Terminal. 

Our only negatives were that the lobby was rather warm (the weather was in the 90s most days), the safe was locked when we wished to store our valuables and we were unable to use it, we were only provided one washcloth daily which seemed odd, and the TV set intermittently lost its signal (sometimes for long periods as we were winding down after a day out and about). 

Overall this was a very good stay and I would recommend this hotel to others.

title: Decent place, great location, good value
text: I was a bit surprised to see the reviews here were negative, I had a good nights stay at this place. The staff were helpful and nice, rooms were decent and the AC was the best one we experienced in NYC. All in all I can definitely recommend it.

title: Shame looks neglected
text: Nice looking  older building but it's like it's been forgotten about its shabby had a few problems safe not working was fixed  very noisy  aircon was fixed dirty bathroom  when we arrived  into room was cleaned tried to charge  us again on arrival  and 200 dollars more than  booked  for. Pity could  be beautiful  boutique style hotel with some t l c

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Having booked this 7 night stay as a Hilton hotel, we were slightly concerned when it changed hands to a Westgate. Reading the recent reviews piled on the worries, but once we had arrived they were gone. The hotel is slightly dated, but kept clean and in order. Our room was cleaned to a high standard daily, with fresh towels and coffee refill to boot. The only slight downside was the reception staff, think they could do with a personality transplant. The bell boys out front were very friendly, helpful and courteous; Mike in particular was the best, with a good knowledge of New York Hardcore music 👍🏻. Would definitely stay again.

title: Forferdelig
text: Dette hotellet het tidligere Hilton New York Grand Central. Fikk ikke noe beskjed om at det var byttet navn før vi ankom hotellet. Vi fikk da først et vanlig dobbeltrom selv om vi hadde bestilt junior-suite. Det står 3 navn på voucher, men i systemet deres var det registrert bare 2 personer. Vi måtte bytte rom 3 ganger før vi endelig fikk et med plass til 3 personer. Renholdet er ok. Servicen er dårlig. Resepsjonen kunne trengt et kurs i å smile. Ser ut som de hater jobben sin og man føler seg lite velkommen. I tillegg klarte hotellet å belaste kortet vårt med over 6000 kroner etter at vi hadde reist. på tross av at vi hadde forhåndsbestilt. Dette er for dårlig. Ligger litt utenfor det meste. 20 minutter å gå til Times Square, 4 minutter å gå til UN-building. Subway i umiddelbar nærhet for den som liker å bruke det. Det finnes mange andre hoteller å bruke enn dette.

title: The promise of elegance
text: I'm rating both recent stay and potential of this statuesque property near the UN in Midtown East.  Loved our Queen Balcony room in this 30's property.  The room was a good size by Manhattan standards. Appointments are nice, if dated.  I know that remodel is planned.  Nice size bathroom with bidet. Shower took a bit to learn but hand held shower head is nice (in addition to regular head). Though we didn't use the jacuzzi tub, it was a good option to have. Comfy bed, could use assortment of pillow firmnesses. Window shades/curtains require some repair, especially the step up entrance (exit?) to the balcony. Access to the balcony needs a step as it's a good 18" or more. Now - the balcony.....the balcony is exquisite. Of the 300 rooms, only 13 have a balcony - really more of a patio.  Ours was at least 8x10 with a wrought iron table and chairs, a view (narrow) of the East River. New owners have been here only a month and there are service issues to be worked out. That said, front desk staff listened and made notes - including considerations for our next visit.  A '3' rating for now, but promises to become a top tier option when visiting NY.

title: Towels???
text:
We booked this hotel when it was a Hilton.  Later got an email right before our trip stating ownership had changed and it was now a Westgate.  We were wary that the quality of the hotel would not be the same and our instincts were correct.  Never again will we stay here.  We had paid extra for the king suite knowing we would need the sofa bed for our kids to sleep in.  Unfortunately, not only was the mattress for the sofa bed so thin that you could feel the springs, but no bedding for the sofa bed was provided. From 8pm-11pm, instead of sleeping, we made 3 unanswered phone calls to housekeeping/the front desk and visited the front desk twice asking for bedding.  Finally at 11pm we were given sheets and 4 towels....but no blanket.  We were told the hotel was out of blankets and we should use the towels as blankets.  What?!?!?  What kind of hotel offering sofa beds as part of their room rate would not have the appropriate bedding?  And using towels as bedding???  I asked for multiple bedsheets instead which we used for warmth.  
To make matters worse, the next day, housekeeping took away all of the extra bedsheets and left us back at square one with no blankets for the sofa bed.  
Incidentally, several items (i.e. cups for the coffee maker) were not replaced and the furniture was covered in dust.   
There are several similarly priced hotels near Grand Central which would be a better option for a family.  I wished we had picked one of them.

title: Make sure they don't charge you twice!!!
text: Stayed in room 701 from Friday 29th June for the weekend were surprised to find when we got there this was no longer a Hilton, no one had told us this and we had paid in advance. On arrival we were told, in quite a rude manner we had to pay, when we insisted and showed our confirmation the gentle man at reception backed down and took a swipe of our card for 'extras'. Imagine our surprise when we got home and checked out our credit card to find they had charged us for our room again and apparently this is not the first time this has happened read other reviews. We had made a point of checking out and at no time did anyone tell us they had recharged us, or offer us a receipt for the money taken! So on the plus side the hotel was really nice but am now feeling really ripped of and have been told by our agent it could take up to 28 days to resolve. Had a great stay in what we thought was a nice hotel now feel ripped of and very sad.

title: Good location
text: Formerly the Hilton Grand Central.  Great location for subway stops.  Some good breakfast and lunch places in the area.  Grand Central and the Chrysler Building are literally right down the street.  Good staff, especially Mike, the bellman up front.

title: Staff does not care about safety
text:
I checked in on 6/22 with a gentleman around 10pm. He was eating almonds and without even looking up just huff “checking in”. He also did not check my ID so literally anyone could gotten access to my room which as a woman traveling alone is terrifying. Then there was a leak coming from the ceiling to which housekeeping and the hotel operator said “what do you want us to do”. I tried speaking with a manager and was transferred to their line, it rang someone picked up the phone did not say a word and hung up. 
This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text:
No longer a Hilton and barely a hotel.
Ownership changed, so if you want to get ripped off, stay here and pay extra charges that aren't on your Hilton bill.

And to top it off, when we entered our room, one of the hotel staff was comfortably sitting and watching TV. And took her time to leave. 

The hotel said, hmmm.

title: Solid choice
text: We were very happy with the location and value from this Hilton. Rooms are on the small side, but that has been my experience everywhere I’ve stayed in NYC. Location is convenient and safe. The housekeeping did forget to replace some items and there’s no fridge or microwave for leftovers, but overall it’s a pleasant stay.

title: Convenient hotel for business travel
text:
I stayed three nights at the Hilton New York Grand Central while in the city for work. This hotel was comfortable, well located in Midtown, and had everything the business traveler needs.

Check in at the Hilton was fast and easy. My room was large for NYC, and had an unexpectedly nice view over a quiet, treelined street. The room was very clean, and while it didn't feature the most modern decor, it didn't seem old or tired. The bed was really comfortable and there was no street noise to speak of. Wifi was complimentary and worked well throughout my stay on multiple devices. Air conditioning and heat both worked nicely, which was great when the weather changed dramatically in the middle of my stay.

Downstairs, there's a cafe and bar that seems to be open in the morning and evening, but closes for a little while mid-day. They offer a wide range of food, from fresh salads and sandwiches to candy bars and snacks. There's plenty of table space outside the cafe to sit with colleagues, and a printer if you need to print something. Hotel staff were very polite and eager to assist with any requests. 

I had a very comfortable stay at the Hilton and would happily stay here again when in NYC.

title: Tiny, noisy, excellent location
text:
The rooms are tiny and ours, 1714, had a huge column interrupting the room. The view was nice and we had three windows. 

The A/C kept clunking every 20-30 minutes ALL night long! 

The location is excellent, right next to Tudor City on 42nd street. It's only a short walk to the subway or the Empire State Building or the UN.

We stayed here due to the location. It was a so-so price for the accommodations. The
